story:
Yang Market has been the cornerstone of Eckington for over 70 years. Located at the corner of Summit & U Streets NE, the store opened in the 1940s as one of many District Grocery Stores (DGS) operating throughout the region. Yang Market has stood witness to the evolution of our neighborhood and city ever since.
 
Yang Market's closing last December was a blow to the neighborhood because it was more than a convenience store, but an integral part of Eckington's history. We saw the need to restore this cornerstone as the place you can get your morning coffee and bagel, satisfy your sweet tooth, and we'll even be there when you run out of dog food.
 
Although it has only been closed for seven months, a great deal of elbow grease was required to bring Yang Market back to life. From the removal of the bulletproof glass, installing a new floor, freshly painted walls, to a double deep cleaning - This restoration has been a family labor of love. Our combined backgrounds include graphic & interior design, home & business organization, hospitality, and marketing. Not only do we see owning Yang Market as a great way to put all our skills to use, but we also want to provide a space for all of Eckington to enjoy.

We've taken care of the heavy lifting and now reaching out to our friends and neighbors for help stocking Yang Market with your favorite things. We look forward to reopening the doors of this Eckington treasure! 

- Alex & Kathleen

About Us
Alexander Clarke has been in the graphic arts & marketing industry for over 20 years. In 2016, he left the corporate sector to start Gorilla Graphics DC, an independent creative firm. 

Kathleen Schroeder worked in the restaurant industry for over a decade after graduating from Pennsylvania State University with a degree in hospitality management. In 2017, she left hospitality and brought a life long dream to reality with the launch of KD Design Company, which specializes in home & business organization. 

Yang Market in the News!

Washingtonian

WTOP

Washington City Paper

story:
Join us now to become a part of the rich Shooting Star history and legacy. 


The Shooting Star Saloon has been serving its community since 1879. The oldest continuously operating bar West of the Mississippi, the Shooting Star remained open - even during those tricky 14 years of Prohibition. But March 2020 changed everything. The COVID-19 epidemic shuttered dozens of small businesses and put hundreds of our community members out of work and even more good folks in a financial squeeze.

As the Owner of the Shooting Star, I’ve done everything possible to ensure the continuous employment of our staff as we’ve navigated this uncertain and challenging time. At times like these, we have two choices: Give up and quit or do something big. 

 

Let’s do something big. . . 

 

This isn’t a handout, it’s an investment in the future. Soon enough, the Shooting Star Saloon will be back to creating new ways to connect, and enjoy time together as a community to celebrate life and each other as soon as the pandemic lifts. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

You don’t have to contribute to make a difference and be a part of the team:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to your social networks, friends, and family.
  • Convince your brother-in-law to donate? He’d love the Shooting Star.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to get the word out. And that’s all there is to it.

 

Looking forward to seeing y’all when we’ve turned this corner together!

 

Reviews

 

“The only Utah bar listed in Esquire magazine’s roundup of the top bars in the U.S. On Sunday afternoons the regular crowd of cowboys and skiers is outnumbered by bikers, and despite the handwritten sign that says WE ARE NOT A RESTAURANT. NO SPECIAL ORDERS, the Shooting Star serves the best burgers in the state.”

— ESQUIRE MAGAZINE

“A visit to The Shooting Star Saloon is a journey into one of the most raucous anomalies in Utah’s teetotaling history. Serving alcohol since 1879 (including those tricky 14 Prohibition years), the Star has made a name for itself as the oldest continuously—operating bar in the West.”

-ATLAS OBSCURA

story:
Short Summary

Ritual Island is a movement, wellness and community studio, co-created by Dr. Emily Bennett ND and movement entrepreneur, Robin Lamarr in 2017, in Hamilton Ontario. Together we’re interested in building self-awareness and community by creating accessible and inclusive experiences through decolonized wellness platforms.

Currently, we are a studio without walls, collaborating with various venues to host movement classes, workshops, and our one-of-a-kind teacher training. Our complementary health services (naturopathic medicine, community acupuncture, massage, counselling, +) operates under Ritual Island's former incarnation, Inland Island, founded by Emily, on King and Locke.

We came together, wanting to collaborate on a bigger vision of how whole body health can reach more people, bringing our joint offerings and radical dreams under one roof. Our services are/will be community considerate and socially engaged. What does this mean? It means every one is welcome, no one is priced out and we are ACTIVELY creating reform in how for-profit-businesses can serve all communities. It means our services are offered on sliding scale. It means we want to create exclusive and safer spaces for marginalized folks. It means we want to use Ritual Island as a launching pad for projects outside of what is typically found at wellness studios.
 
We keep being challenged with the ask, "How badly do you want to build this Ritual Island home? At what cost?". Lucky for Hamilton, we are committed. We believe opening up this home is something we need to do because its benefits go way beyond our career ambition. It's truly for the collective. It's for community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Originally hoping to be open before December, we have faced another delay and won't be able to open until the spring. We've already begun paying rent on this 4000sqft space and have begun renovations. We are IN IT. We don't have the funds to pay rent without operating in the space. So we need to appeal to YOU. Our community. Who we're building this space for. Will you help us?

As a thank you for your support, there are various gifts that you can choose from that range from services at our future studio, to services and sweet goods from our small business friends.

 

The Impact

We are often fundraising and donating our time to various social justice initiatives. This year (our first year in existence!) we raised $1050 for RAICES Texas (benefitting the Mexican family migrant crisis), $707.50 for Interval House (a women's shelter in Hamilton), our teacher training is THE FIRST program to offer scholarships to people of colour, and we have just launched the Root to Bloom tote for a Six Nations immersion school. We treat our work as a way to spread a message of active compassion and to empower community.

Our community studio will allow us to share more of our services. At least 25% of our services will be offered on sliding scale. We will have multiple pay-what-you-can movement classes offered throughout the week. The pay-what-you-can proceeds will benefit community causes like local women’s shelters and indigenous health centres. We will create exclusive programming for marginalized folks, ex: BIPOC (black, indigenous, people of colour) and Queer and Trans movement workshops. We will be able to offer more community acupuncture hours, giving our practitioners more work, but also expanding on a financially considerate health service for more people to access.

The Ritual Island home will help ALL OF US continue to do this work - self-care for community care. We hope you can show up for us so we can continue to show up for you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! About this campaign. About our work.

WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER and are so grateful for all of your support.

We've already begun paying rent on this 4000sqft space and have begun renovations. We are IN IT. We don't have the funds to pay rent without operating in the space. So we need to appeal to YOU. Our community. Who we're building this space for. Will you help us?
As a thank you for your support, there are various gifts that you can choose from that range from services at our future studio, to services and sweet goods from our small business friends.

 
The Impact
We are often fundraising and donating our time to various social justice initiatives. This year (our first year in existence!) we raised $1050 for RAICES Texas (benefitting the Mexican family migrant crisis), $707.50 for Interval House (a women's shelter in Hamilton), our teacher training is THE FIRST program to offer scholarships to people of colour, and we have just launched the Root to Bloom tote for a Six Nations immersion school. We treat our work as a way to spread a message of active compassion and to empower community.
Our community studio will allow us to share more of our services. At least 25% of our services will be offered on sliding scale. We will have multiple pay-what-you-can movement classes offered throughout the week. The pay-what-you-can proceeds will benefit community causes like local women’s shelters and indigenous health centres. We will create exclusive programming for marginalized folks, ex: BIPOC (black, indigenous, people of colour) and Queer and Trans movement workshops. We will be able to offer more community acupuncture hours, giving our practitioners more work, but also expanding on a financially considerate health service for more people to access.
The Ritual Island home will help ALL OF US continue to do this work - self-care for community care. We hope you can show up for us so we can continue to show up for you.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us spread the word! About this campaign. About our work.
WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER and are so grateful for all of your support.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jason Dean Holness and I am the Founder of the Black Owned Businesses and Entrepreneurship (BOBE) Group. As a Social Entrepreneur, Activist and Afro-futurist; I have always been keen to use my ideas to create solutions to social problems and provide tools for the sustainable development of marginalized communities.

Consequently,  lack of job opportunities, high unemployment rates, social exclusion and lack of structural support are some of the issues affecting Africa and African diaspora peoples all over Scandinavia. Reports published by the Länsstyrelsen Stockholm, 2018, shows that nowadays anti-black racism and discrimination in the labor market is on the rise. There exists  a clear connection between a person's income and access to the labor market and the color of a person's skin, despite the possession of equivalent qualifications.

As a result of this many people from the African diaspora, including myself, have been forced to create businesses in order to offset the barriers and challenges presented to us by structural and symbolic racism. Unfortunately, though African and African diaspora peoples are starting businesses at greater rates, they are also failing at greater rates. Many new African and African diaspora businesses never get off the ground and for those that do actually start, they are not growing as quickly or as big as white-owned companies.

African and African diaspora people are very entrepreneurial oriented, yet they are failing at very high rates, this is a clear indication that something in the process is causing that. According to Black business owners and analysts this can be attributed to a lack of proper planning, poor capital structure and stigmas.

The Black Owned Business and Entrepreneurship (BOBE) Group started with the purpose of positively impacting Swedish and by large Scandinavian society, by using business and entrepreneurship as a means to create a space for African and African diaspora peoples to succeed and to prosper in spite of the challenges they face in the labor market. We  aim to promote a positive image of African and African diaspora peoples as entrepreneurial , innovative and successful business owners.

The Black Owned Business and Entrepreneurship (BOBE) Summit is among the BOBE group of activities and will be hosted for the first time on May 4, 2019 in Copenhagen , and we aim for it to be the largest Summit for African and African diasporic businesses, entrepreneurs and business professionals in Scandinavia. We invite current business owners, entrepreneurs, business professionals and participants in the public discourse to our Summit to be party to keynote speeches, seminars and discussions around our event theme “Elevating the narrative and creating a culture among black owned businesses and entrepreneurs”. 

We aim to create value by providing the array of diverse entrepreneurs in attendance with networking, partnership, financing, and other business-building opportunities.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise 10.000 DKK for the BOBE Summit 2019 to cover travel costs and accomodation of our keynote speakers.

The funds will be used to pay for the following:


Hotel for Speakers
Airfare for Speakers 
Miscellaneous Travel Expenses for Speakers
Speaker Swag Bags 
T-Shirts and Swag Bags (+ bag contents) 
Miscellaneous Expenses
Catering Expenses

We are seeking some powerful and passionate partners to help make this conference a raving success. We would love your support and contributions to make it happen. Making a financial donation to the conference is the best way to support. 

ADDITIONALLY: We are seeking sponsors for the conference. We are looking for people/business owners who are willing to contribute items to the swag bags and offer door prizes for our guests. We are expecting over 150 participants at the conference.

 

The Impact

The BOBE Summit is so vital to African and African diaspora entrepreneurs and business owners on a local and national level: “Our Summit is addressing the greatest issue facing black businesses. I argue that the biggest challenge to our companies isn’t just the lack of access to capital. It’s scale and the knowledge of how to do so.

Currently, 95% of Afrian and African diaspora businesses are sole proprietorships, which means that most African and African Diaspora entrepreneurs are employing themselves. We are using this event to help them build capacity so that they do business with large corporations and as a result, employ large numbers of African and African diaspora peoples and impact on our communities.

The BOBE Summit 2019 will address issues confronting today’s business owners, including how to handle daunting competitive obstacles, leverage technology to achieve greater efficiency and profitability, and learn to pivot in an increasingly fast-paced, chaotic environment.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help - You can help us by posting to Facebook, Twitter, blogs or anywhere you socialize.  Be sure to grab a link from the Indiegogo share tools so we can track how far the message spreads!

Write an email to that African and African diaspora business, professional, Friend, relative or entrepreneur you know that may need to attend this conference.  Let them know about the conference and this campaign!

You can also support us by REGISTERING for the event via our eventbrite page:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/black-owned-busine...

Go tell an African and African diaspora business owner or an entrepreneur you know that he or she is doing a great job and support them.  Will that help this campaign?  Probably not but the reason I started this was to support African and African diaspora businesses and entrepreneurs who are just doing the very best they can, trying to establish successful businesses in order to create sustainable wealth for themselves and to provide for their families.  Being an entrepreneur or a business owner is a tough job and when you support an entrepreneur or a business owner you make a positive impact in this world and more so within the community.

story:
What’s Going On?

On March 17th, Austin officials ordered the temporary closure of all dine-in restaurants and bars & gathering of 10 or more people through May 1st. 

We’re New Waterloo, a local hospitality company with nearly 1,000 employees working across our 2 hotels, 12 restaurants + bars, and 1 golf course. Due to the mandated closure, 550 of our employees are now displaced, unable to make a living with us, and forced to file for unemployment.

What We Need + What's In It For You

Our company motto: Have fun, be nice. And damned if we aren’t going to do what we can to keep that motto alive + well.

What we need is simple — dollars in the hands of our employees who cannot work for the foreseeable future. We will be closed for at least 45 days — that is 45 days our staff must wait in line for unemployment, worry about how they will pay for their rent + other bills, and wonder how they will support their families. 

100% of profits made from this campaign will be divided + directly paid out between our 550 furloughed employees. Your donation will tangibly + positively impact the lives of the service industry workers who make Austin what it is, and help ensure they can come back to us, safe + healthy, when our doors can be open once more. Our goal is to raise at least $125,000, but every additional dollar we make will go towards this same mission.

In addition to the warm fuzzy feelings of knowing you are supporting great people and Austin’s economy as a whole during an unsettling time, we’ve got some incredibly talented people at New Waterloo + in our community who are donating their time, talents + cool prizes to sweeten the pot for you! 

PRIZES INCLUDE:

  • Personalized 15-gallon barrel of Garrison Brothers bourbon
  • Private concert with Darden Smith
  • Two-night stay at Michael Hsu-designed Hill Country ranch house
  • Year's supply of Topo Chico

You can also choose to make a general donation to be split amongst all property employees by clicking Back It at the top of this page.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that more industries than ours are suffering, and empathize with others being financially hit. If you aren’t able to make a donation, there are other ways you can ensure your favorite restaurants + bars don’t shut down permanently due to this crisis.

  • Share this campaign. Austin has a lot of people who love to go out to eat + drink, and want to keep the industry alive for when this is all over. Please consider sharing this campaign via social media, text or verbally with anyone + everyone to help us reach our goal. We can’t do it without you.
  • Support the Independent Restaurant Coalition. This campaign is all about our team, but the underlying issue is so much bigger than any of us. We need legislation in place NOW to preserve our economy when all is said and done. Learn how you can support essential legislation to save the hospitality industry at saverestaurants.co.
  • Come see us soon. We will be back as soon as we can, and we will need your support tenfold when our doors open again. When that day comes, come by, say hello + have a drink and a non-virtual high five with us — we can’t wait to see you!

If you do have the means to donate — even what you would be tipping on a drink this weekend back in our now-alternate, normal universe — every dollar counts. If you’ve ever created memories with friends + family in one of our spots, had exceptional service or remember a time when one of our staff members went above + beyond for you, please consider supporting our staff during this time when they need you most.

Thank you for your continued support — it means the world to us!

story:
Who We Are and What We Do!

Freedom Yoga is a destination for a mindful connection, to yourself and the community around you.

We offer a contemporary version of yoga that works for busy lives, and we exist to support your unique physical, emotional and spiritual growth.

We are committed to uplifting our students though asana, great music and community.

Find your intuition; find freedom in connecting with yourself!

~Bridget~

Bridget fell into yoga over 10 years ago and has been committed to sharing her love for the practice ever since. 

Trained in the Ashtanga method of practice, Bridget teaches Slow Burn and Vinyasa classes both based on that system. Her classes are an eclectic pairing of hard and the soft, making them challenging and uplifting. 

Bridget is an Ambassador for lululemon athletica Woodfield and is also a Yoga Teacher Training Faculty member, leading 200hr Teacher Trainings in the Chicagoland area.

When not teaching Bridget enjoys practicing yoga with her three kids, hunting for vintage treasures, matcha lattes, spending time outdoors in the sunshine, and Netflix marathons

 

~Susie~

Susie is a 200 hour certified yoga instructor, who discovered Yoga at a difficult juncture of her life. Trained in Ashtanga, Vinyasa, SlowBurn and Yin styles of yoga Susie's classes are a great fit for all levels of students.

Yoga has become a mind and body journey that was needed to stay mentally, spiritually and physically healthy in a difficult season. Susie discovered perfectionism has no place in yoga, but a continual, individual journey that opens doors for healing, discovering and finding a new in all aspects of your life. She loves to practice Ashtanga, Vinyasa and Hatha Yoga and always loves being a student of yoga.

When off her yoga mat Susie is a foodie who loves trying new restaurants, dancing with girlfriends, chatty nights with wine, a good book and playing with her 5 year old boy.

 

Building this studio ...

Owning a yoga space has been a goal for both of us for many years. With the current studio location closing, we have the opportunity to bring a fresh and contemporary version of yoga into the Chicago suburbs. Offering a wide range of classes from Ashtanga to Hip Hop Vinyasa, Yin Yoga & Meditation, Freedom Yoga Center has a class for every student.

Live streaming classes (available early 2017) allow for students to connect with their favorite classes anywhere anytime. Wait for our Youtube Channel, it's coming soon! 

 We will be renovating the space in the upcoming weeks allowing not only for sacred space to practice in, but a place for our yoga community to blossom and grow! 

In the upcoming weeks; 

  • We will be removing two small walls
  • Building a new entrance into the studio (no more noise between classes!)
  • Build a gathering space for students before and after class + dressing rooms
  • New floors

Pre purchasing any of our yoga packages helps us get started! 

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course with any new business there are risks, we do have competition in our area. An already successful client base has been built in the standing space, and both Susie and Bridget bring with community followings as well as connections to many successful teachers throughout out the area. Our biggest hurdle will be to continue consistent growth, we plan to do this with the following;

  • YTT coming spring 2017
  • Monthly Workshops and Events
  • Lifestyle classes
  • Community gatherings
  • Free weekly karma classes

Our website should be up and running soon, but in the meantime check out a few of our class offerings below!

Essentials

Build simple flows to discover how your body works and feels in this grounding practice. Learn to connect your breath to movement. Guided breathing techniques aid in reliving stress through standing postures. Accessible and engaging for all levels of students.

Vinyasa

Find freedom in your body through flowing movement, connecting asana and breath through fresh uplifting music.  A vigorous style of yoga, Vinyasa will test your strength, balance and flexibility, while creating internal heat. Vinyasa is open to all levels and will connect you to your own intuitive practice.

Ashtanga

An introduction to the foundations of Ashtanga yoga, this class explores sun salutations, ujjayi breath, energy locks and vinyasas.  By synchronizing the breath with a progressive series of postures, this class is designed for students of all levels who want to increase endurance and quiet the mind.  Room is moderately heated.

Ashtanga Remix

A class for the serious and seasoned student.  This essential class, based on the classic ashtanga system, will explore traditional sequencing, as well as variations and modifications.  Vinyasa style heat and music included!

Candlelight Vinyasa and Meditation

Move into your evening with this dynamic class designed to melt away the stress of the day in a heated room.  A vigorous style of yoga, Moonlight Vinyasa will test your strength, balance and flexibility, while creating internal heat.  Includes a short meditation amidst candlelight to quiet the mind. 

Yin is a restorative yoga practice designed to ease our active bodies and minds. Yin affects the deeper fibers of our connective tissue to give us a serene, relaxation effect. All postures are practiced on the floor in a seated or lying position, with each posture being held for 3 to 5 minutes. Yin is the perfect compliment to our Vinyasa and Slow burn classes as a restorative measure to keep our bodies in check, allowing us to practice yoga for years to come

 

Thank you for your continued support! We look forward to seeing you on your mat at 403 South Arlington Heights Rd - early October 2016!

story:
Learning a great accent is fundamentally about talking to people. That’s what we care about the most at Accent Artisan. We believe that we talk before we write and we listen before we read. Whether you want to move to the US and pursue your American dream, or you’re a teacher, a call center crusader or just an enthusiast, you’re always talking to people. Nobody can see inside your head and that’s why being heard and understood plays such a critical role in our lives. By contributing to this campaign you could help people to get better jobs, grow in their careers, get access to better education or make it big in Hollywood ;-).

People have all kinds of limiting beliefs when it comes to language acquisition. There are many reasons why they think it’s impossible to sound like a native, or why it’s not that important. Unfortunately, these beliefs are often shared with language teachers and even accent coaches.

It can be a challenge to show people they can do something they’re not sure they can do. Accent Artisan is different because Adam went through that process. We not only know it’s possible, but we also know what it takes to get there.

People spend a lot of money and time on studying English. 

Today at least 1.5 billion people speak English of which only about 375 million are native speakers. Some manage to move to an English-speaking country and yet after 20 years of living there they still sound like they just got off the boat. In the vast job market open to English speakers, not all of the 1 billion plus non-native speakers are considered equal.

Studies consistently show that your accent plays a massive role in how you are perceived, how you understand native speakers and how they understand you. English is a stress-based language. That means a great deal of meaning is conveyed through pauses, emphasis, intonation. It's not enough to spell things out.

We know that it is absolutely possible to learn a language to the same degree as a native speaker. To learn to speak with a native speaker's accent, you don’t have to be raised in a particular country or have been exposed to the language at home from an early age, as many people still believe. Accent Artisan aims to tear down those myths.

For this reason Accent Artisan is primarily intended for non-native English speakers. With this campaign our goal is to create the first section of a comprehensive self-guided platform for the Accent Artisan method. This section is dedicated to showing you how to master the basic pronunciation patterns of the English language.

This is where your contributions come in.

The bulk of the funds we need will go to the Accent Artisan iPhone app. Why an iPhone app? Because you get an awesome easy-to-use product that you can take anywhere you go.

Quality is number 1 for us - in teaching and in presentation. We understand that part of great functionality is a great design. All of us are happier using something that’s pretty AND functional.

We would like to work with the very well experienced team at Cleevio. 

These are the guys that have made apps like Snippit, Youradio, Spendee, Taasky and more. They also worked with Coca Cola, Nestlé, Oreo etc. Quality isn’t cheap and so with their help we have calculated:

Graphics - $5,180

Coding and graphics implementation - $1,850

Programming and development - $12,210

Testing of application and fixing bugs - $1,850

Database and backend - $4,400

Testing of application and ripening - $1,110 

Marketing - $2,300

Of course we understand that not everybody can support us financially, but there is always a way to help out. If you like our project, help us by getting the word out. Share it on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram… Give us a shout out on your YouTube channel or just tell your mum about us.

Thank you for your support!
story_txt: Learning a great accent is fundamentally about talking to people. That’s what we care about the most at Accent Artisan. We believe that we talk before we write and we listen before we read. Whether you want to move to the US and pursue your American dream, or you’re a teacher, a call center crusader or just an enthusiast, you’re always talking to people. Nobody can see inside your head and that’s why being heard and understood plays such a critical role in our lives. By contributing to this campaign you could help people to get better jobs, grow in their careers, get access to better education or make it big in Hollywood ;-).People have all kinds of limiting beliefs when it comes to language acquisition. There are many reasons why they think it’s impossible to sound like a native, or why it’s not that important. Unfortunately, these beliefs are often shared with language teachers and even accent coaches.It can be a challenge to show people they can do something they’re not sure they can do. Accent Artisan is different because Adam went through that process. We not only know it’s possible, but we also know what it takes to get there.People spend a lot of money and time on studying English. Today at least 1.5 billion people speak English of which only about 375 million are native speakers. Some manage to move to an English-speaking country and yet after 20 years of living there they still sound like they just got off the boat. In the vast job market open to English speakers, not all of the 1 billion plus non-native speakers are considered equal.Studies consistently show that your accent plays a massive role in how you are perceived, how you understand native speakers and how they understand you. English is a stress-based language. That means a great deal of meaning is conveyed through pauses, emphasis, intonation. It's not enough to spell things out.We know that it is absolutely possible to learn a language to the same degree as a native speaker. To learn to speak with a native speaker's accent, you don’t have to be raised in a particular country or have been exposed to the language at home from an early age, as many people still believe. Accent Artisan aims to tear down those myths.For this reason Accent Artisan is primarily intended for non-native English speakers. With this campaign our goal is to create the first section of a comprehensive self-guided platform for the Accent Artisan method. This section is dedicated to showing you how to master the basic pronunciation patterns of the English language.This is where your contributions come in.The bulk of the funds we need will go to the Accent Artisan iPhone app. Why an iPhone app? Because you get an awesome easy-to-use product that you can take anywhere you go.Quality is number 1 for us - in teaching and in presentation. We understand that part of great functionality is a great design. All of us are happier using something that’s pretty AND functional.We would like to work with the very well experienced team at Cleevio. These are the guys that have made apps like Snippit, Youradio, Spendee, Taasky and more. They also worked with Coca Cola, Nestlé, Oreo etc. Quality isn’t cheap and so with their help we have calculated:Graphics - $5,180Coding and graphics implementation - $1,850Programming and development - $12,210Testing of application and fixing bugs - $1,850Database and backend - $4,400Testing of application and ripening - $1,110 Marketing - $2,300Of course we understand that not everybody can support us financially, but there is always a way to help out. If you like our project, help us by getting the word out. Share it on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram… Give us a shout out on your YouTube channel or just tell your mum about us.Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors mostly fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. In our case, we are both disabled veterans of the military and honorably discharged. Marti (the husband chef) was injured and operated on during Operation Iraqi Freedom. As vetrepreneurs, we have been remarkably successful in running our bed and breakfast, The Inn of the Patriots (www.theinnofthepatriots.com at 704-937-2940), for eight years and have won numerous #1 awards, worldwide. We are also a DIAMOND LISTED PROPERTY with AAA.  We are not a hairbrained idea, not a startup, and not incubating anything.  We are a well-honed success story, looking to expand.

  • Marti was a White House Chef, a manager of the Camp David Resort and Conference Center and has led numerous hotels and inns to success worldwide.  He's done interior design worldwide and also runs the onsite culinary institute.  After retiring with 21 years in the military, he graduated summa cum laude with a Bachelors (3.98 GPA) from the Art Institute.  It was his dream always to go to college.  Stormy is his chef wife and also an accountant doing payroll for over 10 million dollars and 400+ employees in her day-job in Charlotte, NC.  When back home as innkeeper and chef she leads the dinners and tours of the inn and on-site museum.  Stormy is a Professional in Human Resources with a (PHR) designation via the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM).
  • We would like to raise enough money by just selling rooms and gift shop items to expand, add two more suites and convert our kitchen to a restaurant and catering kitchen.  We have the contract bid in hand.
  • Once we were featured to 2.6 billion people via CNN, appeared in the New Yorker Magazine, Washington Post, The London Times, on PBS and as a prize to 62 million on Wheel of Fortune - things took off!  And, it is illegal for our White House Chef to serve food to the public without a certified restaurant kitchen - which as you know the stainless steel machines, sinks, and counters are twice the cost of regular stoves and such at Best Buy.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We've done this before in 2009, with $146,000.00 in room sales to the public and had no problems ensuring every single person had their stay honored. We launched our business this way, so we know it works! We set a world record by avoiding the banks and welcoming folks like you.
  • This time, we are offering our six-course colonial breakfast with all rooms daily (all have private bathrooms now), wine tasting of ten wines at the local winery, triple-cider flight at the wine bar, free appetizer and dessert at local restaurants and sweet treats with fruit all day long at the inn (free), 100 Mbps free wi-fi for all, free parking, as well as complimentary bottle of water in room upon arrival.
  • Any amount of contribution will help. 
  • If we don't reach our full goal, we will scale back our furnishings in the new suites or not do the new restaurant - but you'll still enjoy your stay in any of our five rooms with private baths, and all promised.  Primarily we are selling room packages right here. We've done that for a long, long time, with super-high marks on earth. The risk of failure, therefore, is zero risk of your funds, and your return is not predicated upon the market, dividend issue nor distributions.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in numerous veterans lives, small business, the injured and disabled as well as the small town of Grover, NC.

  • Veterans returning home are now turning to us, to provide hope, to teach and help them, how to become successful.
  • Our museum, onsite, is the US Presidential Culinary Museum.  We will be placing every single donors name onto our foundation website at www.presidentialculinarymuseum.org
  • We own our own business because society trusted us in war - to protect America, and to bring integrity, honor, commitment, and duty to small businesses.  Literally, to show the world what we can become!

  • You are forever stating that you support war veterans by patronizing veteran owned businesses.  Your support means the ENTIRE WORLD TO OUR SUCCESS AS FELLOW AMERICANS!

Risks & Challenges

People value transparency. Being open and standing out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal, is critical.

  • We have unprecedented hotelier experience up to 1500 room properties.
  • We've managed resorts, private homes, and inns across three continents. 
  • We may not raise the desired goal and fall flat on our face.
  • We realize there are a select few betting we will fail.  We motivate forward.
  • We are well aware of those who do not like military veterans that have served. We go around them and into the darkness, towards winning.
  • We have experienced the troubles of the VA hospital system ourselves. We pray to God for others and shine as the beacon of success to watch and follow.
  • We would just honor the overnight stays like we always have and then turn to private investors, angel investors and Venture Capitol funds.
  • An additional fall-back plan is for us to launch a Crowdfunder.com campaign to structure a deal where unaccredited investors can come in under the new JOBS ACT.
  • We continue to look for opportunities to have a longer term offered, with more favorable rates, SBA 504 backing and a partner to provide equity infusion.  This would allow us to expand to a property in Grover of 357 acres currently for sale, exercise up to 20 million in promised funds from Morgan Stanley and go to 200 rooms at The American Revolutionary War Living History Center The ARWLHC

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • You can mention us to friends and family, that we are fighters.
  • You can contact the media and suggest they do a story on us.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Let us imagine wheelchair users enjoy a tourist attraction in an open, barrier free environment.


It's not easy for people in wheelchairs to go through a 2 cm-high bump, a steep slope, or a wheelchair inaccessible vehicle while some with abilities take the conveniences for granted.


We should be aware that a wheelchair user generally has the limits of sight within 100 cm.

Inaccessible environment and disabled-unfriendly attitude more or less may lead disabled people to figure the possibilities of burdening their friends and family and so outdoor activities seem unreachable because anxiety goes before their dreams.


Duofu Care & Service

The founder of Duofu, Jeff Hsu, had no idea about accessible service in his twelve-year mass media working life. One day, Jeff’s ninety years old grandmother got injured, ill, couldn't move by herself, and needed a wheelchair; those unexpectable changes in Jeff's mind kindled the light of a better accessible setting for wheelchair users. In order to fulfill the ultimate concern to accessible service, Jeff was committed to the very first independent accessible transport company in Taiwan.

Duofu is now at Taipei in Taiwan, a beautiful island lying off the coast of China in the Pacific Ocean. Since May 15, 2009, it has been pioneering as a 24/7 accessible transport supplier. Wheelchair users can harmonize their mobility simply with a phone call.

Established six years ago and, despite a variety of unfavorable circumstances, Duofu keeps its gentle and steady influence in schools, hotels, movie theaters, and other places, holding a passionate and respectful heart to share the necessity of a wheelchair accessible environment. 


Duofu Believes…


A developed society always provides comprehensive care.
No one is physically challenged, only environment.


Over the past six years, we have gone a long way, allaying down and nurturing seeds of possibility.

However,

We will not be easily satisfied. 
We will not rest.

Over the next six years, we will be devoted to converting Taiwan into an accessible environment.To reach this goal, both increased interaction and vitality will be necessary.


Enjoy accessibility in Taiwan – Your supportive purchase will make our dreams come true. A sustainable and accessible tour with comfort and care for travelers is our appreciation of your help.




Why Taiwan?


Natural + Breathtaking
An impressive mountainous island, Taiwan, reaches an elevation of 4,000 ft. in some spots. The total shoreline has more than 1,200 km. In 2014, National Geography Traveler recommended Taiwan one of the 20 Best Trip Destinations. Magnificent nature and friendly approach will be the main themes on tour. Taiwanese cuisine  is another key feature that invites the discerning tongues to the essence of Chinese culture, e.g., Din Tai Fung dumplings, street snacks – deep-fried stinky tofu, bubble tea, and mango smoothie.   


Access All Ways
Duofu will be there for your flight arrival at the airport. Pick-up service on an accessible shuttle bus will assist to check-in at hotel and go direct to a tourist attraction. Each route has been comprehensively surveyed and designed by our experienced travel planner, including how to get to wheelchair accessible bathroom. Portable equipment and tools are available for desired yet less accessible scenic spots.   


Customize Trip
In contrast to a standard package tour, a hassle-free itinerary will offer quality time for wheelchair users and their family. You may join the following travel plans as a gift or share with your loved ones.  


Support Our Goal Of
Promoting Accessible Service

In the near future, Taiwan will become one of the most ageing population country in the world. There are many wheelchair users who never know about accessible transport, for lack of information or couldn’t afford the fare of accessible service which result in miserableevent. More vitality and support will advanced us to expand our service to those in need, to relieve their stress from being disabled.

We welcome you, your family and friends to join our exceptional travel routes in Taiwan. With your perspective, we would make progress in our service, and to make Taiwan as an accessible paradise in Asia.

If you would like to support our goal of promoting accessible service, you can plan an accessible trip to Taiwan with your friends and family or purchase one of our trips from the U.S. and give it as a gift, for example to an elderly couple in a host family that you stayed with when you were an international student in Asia. The purchaser of the plan doesn’t have to necessarily be one of the travelers. Join one of our accessible trips or help our funding to help us serve more physically challenged.



For more details please visit FAQ


Cheer Us

story:
WOODEN GATE - PRODUCTION BUILDING / STUDIO

Over the past year we have been raising what felt like an impossible amount of money for some start-up capital - the goal was to renovate a derelict building in Gateshead into a film production office and studio...  and with just £1,500 left to find, WE HAVE NEARLY DONE IT!


FUNDING THE BUILDING DEVELOPMENT SO FAR...

The Directors of Wooden Gate have so far invested £10,000 in to the building development. Phase 1 of the renovation was covered under this cost, which included the safe removal of asbestos materials from site, structural repairs to the roof, demolition, waste removal, planning permission and architectural designs.

Northern Film & Media - Development Grant

Northern Film & Media have offered a £3,000 development grant towards the project, as the building will not only improve the workflow and development of Wooden Gate's Arrangement of Thorns feature film, which is scheduled later for this year, but also each subsequent production. Other future film titles from Wooden Gate include: The Red King, First Class Citizen, Lubricious and Somnium. NFM's continuing support and advice has been fantastic!

Corporate Partners

Wooden Gate is in the process of establishing successful partnerships between a wide range of companies and businesses. Funds raised from our Corporate Partnership scheme have already contributed to exciting developments such as this. Our most recent Corporate Partner is  the award-winning 'Y Salon', based in Eldon Gardens, Newcastle, headed up by entrepreneur and property developer Angela Lowery. The team at 'Y Salon' have been mutually involved in supporting Wooden Gate since pre-production on Arrangement of Thorns.

For more information on becoming a Corporate Partner, please click here.

Personal Donations 

Wooden Gate is hugely grateful to the individuals who are pledging, or have already pledged, towards campaigns such as this. In response Wooden Gate has offered supporters recognition by becoming a 'Wooden Gate Friend'. This entitles you to the following: advance notice of events & trailers, your name listed on the Wooden Gate website, a quarterly newsletter and 5% discount on production services, equipment rental and costume hire.

For more information click here.


What will the money go towards...

Successfully raising the last £1,500 will result in being able to move forward with the building development. This sum of money will renovate the commercial property into a production office and creative studio space - allowing Wooden Gate to develop bigger projects and to create a more sustainable business. In short the funds will go towards a full remodel including:

  • Double glazing windows and doors
  • Replacement heating system and water works
  • Structural work to create larger spaces such as the creative studio space
  • Full Remodel of the Interior Rooms
  • Post-Production Equipment and Facilities
Those involved in the project are excited to see the building reopened and put back into use on Gateshead's High Street.

The next step for Wooden Gate...

Over the past year, Wooden Gate has been representing the North East on screen both in the UK and Internationally. The short film 'Arrangement of Thorns' has since went on to be screened at Marbella International Film Festival (Spain), The Dracula Horror and Fantasy International Festival (Romania), the charming Tyneside Cinema (Newcastle), and will be included online in the BFI: Flare Film Festival (London) this month.

Check out the link to the 'Arrangement of Thorns' short film below:

Once the building is up and running, Wooden Gate will launch straight into developing the feature length adaptation of Arrangement of Thorns and The Red King. 




- Wooden Gate

www.Wooden-Gate-Productions.com

story:
Update: Last Day of the Campaign

So here it is, the last day of the campaign! We have thrown out the $25k goal (see table of funding levels below) and replaced it with a (very possible) $5,000 goal. Thank you to our awesome contributors for getting us this far!

To reduce startup costs, we have adapted our strategy in these ways: 1) Build a smaller, more affordable distillation unit; heated with propane rather than electricity (going with propane saves us over $500 in build costs). 2) Pushed back greenhouse planting until May when heating will not be necessary; seeds will be started in mid to late April. 3) Initial planting will be around half of the greenhouse; costs will be saved by reducing upfront growing medium and organic fertilizer needs. 4) Early sales will be increased by adding a limited retail element to our sales mix.

The Company

Blue Ridge Aromatics is a craft essential oil distillery in the beautiful Appalachian mountains of Western North Carolina. This business has been in development since 2010 and we're ready to hit the ground running!

Our pilot grow space is a formerly vacant 6,000 square foot greenhouse on 4 acres in a fertile valley about 15 minutes north of downtown Asheville; home to over 170 businesses that practice aromatherapy and 7+ schools of natural healing. 

Our greenhouse is certified-organic with an innovative vertical hydroponic growing system. This design multiplies the grow space and represents a harvest potential of up to 2,000 lbs of plants per month. The rotating harvest is then steam-distilled in a custom-built stainless steel distillation unit using ancient techniques. 

Our initial production capacity is up to 10 liters of essential oil (the equivalent of 650 15ml bottles) per month. At this volume, Blue Ridge Aromatics will hire more employees and expand our cultivation outdoors in 2016 (outdoor planting opens up new species/product possibilities that are not well-suited for hydroponics). 

The Team

The Blue Ridge Aromatics team is comprised of me (Ian Montgomery) and a few select advisors. This business is the natural outcome of my life's story. I have always tried to spend more time outside than in. Thus, I have worked with my hands in many trades over the years but my favorite (by far) has been horticulture. I have held management positions in nursery building and propagation, hydroponic greenhouse production and golf course maintenance.

However, my passion for learning is unceasing so I also found myself studying Cultural Anthropology in Asheville, NC, Ecotourism development in Honduras and earning a Master's of Business Administration - Sustainable Enterprise in San Rafael, CA. 

Since 2010, I have extensively researched essential oil distillation; directly consulting with distillers, still builders, practitioners, essential oil analysts and seasoned industry experts. Finally, in January, 2015 I decided that it was time to leave my day job and completely devote my effort to the launch of Blue Ridge Aromatics!

Our Need and Your Perks

Update: Perks are now priced lower! Since we cannot edit perks, existing contributors' shipments will match new contributors' perks.

With our $25,000 goal, we will have the funds needed to:

  • Build a large food-grade stainless steel steam-distillation unit
  • Prepare the greenhouse for production
  • Purchase supplies, tools and laboratory instruments
  • Operate for 3 months
  • Build-out a stunning website where customers can check product batch numbers to learn growing conditions, chemical analyses and other info
  • Produce the oil and hydrosol for your Indiegogo perks (and more to sample and sell locally)

Our campaign perks are pre-orders for our essential oils and hydrosols. Plant species to be determined by the level of funding raised and contributors' feedback. We want local practitioners to have first dibs on our essential oils so national sales are not currently being planned, however out of town supporters of this campaign will have the exclusive option to purchase from us again!

Effects of different fundraising levels:

  • $8,000 - We can build our still. Greenhouse opening will be delayed until May when heating expenses are lower. First cultivated products available in August. Wild-harvested perks shipped July 2015. 1 part-time employee initially, switching to full-time when momentum builds.
  • $15,000 - We can build our still and begin greenhouse production in April. Wild-harvested perks shipped July 2015. 1 full-time employee in 2015.
  • $25,000 (goal) - All the capital we need to meet our budget. Greenhouse planted in late March. Perks sent June 2015. 1 full-time and 1 part-time employee in 2015.
  • $30,000 - Build a second still on a trailer, facilitating mobile essential oil distillation services for regional growers. Greenhouse planted in March. Prepare our 4-acre plot for planting in fall 2015. 2+ full-time employees in 2015. Perks and early product offerings will be more diverse. Perks ship June 2015.
  • $40,000 -  Build 2 stills (one mobile). Greenhouse planted in March. Immediately plant our 4-acre plot with aromatic crops for fall 2015 distillations. 3+ full-time employees for 2015. Perks and early product offerings will be more diverse. Perks ship June 2015.

We understand what it's like to be strapped for cash! So we have priced our perks as low as $15 (with a $5 donation level as well). 

We want to be clear that perk fulfillment will take priority over a rapid startup time frame. After all, without you, this initiative goes nowhere. As long as funding exceeds $4,000 we can build our still and can thus distill wild-harvested species in order to fulfill your perks. In this scenario, additional distillations and sales will be needed before we will have the capital to purchase supplies to plant the greenhouse. In the unlikely event that we do not meet this minimum funding level, worry not, we will build a smaller still and perks will be fulfilled over a longer period.

Since the campaign's success relies on social sharing, any Facebook, Linkedin, Google+ and Twitter sharing you do makes a huge difference and we would appreciate the heck out of you for doing so! Indiegogo makes this easy with their sharing buttons at the top of the page. If you blog, writing a quick story about us would be monumentally helpful. 

What species will our first oil offerings be? 

We encourage contributors to indicate a species preference. This will help shape our first few crops. At funding levels below our stretch goals, it will take time to build a variety of inventory so, unfortunately, we will not be able to offer a variety of species for our perks. Some organic species we are considering for our first crops: Peppermint, Spearmint, Thyme, Geranium, Oregano, German Chamomile, Roman Chamomile.

That said, we have all kinds of great ideas! Here is a teaser:

  • Outdoor cultivated plants such as Lavender, Clary Sage, Rosemary and Hops.
  • Wild-harvested native species like Spruce, Hemlock, Fir and Cedar.
  • Local exotic invasives such as Rosa multiflora (wild-climbing rose).
  • Non-local exotic invasives like a Tea Tree variety in FL.
  • Discarded Christmas trees and trimmings (a major local agricultural industry).
  • The use of essential oils and hydrosols in beer and spirits production (we are Beer City USA after all).

Risks and Challenges

Any startup business faces risks. The following conditions are all working together to substantially reduce these planning and operations risks: 
  • Extensive horticultural experience. 
  • Advanced business and sustainability education and experience.
  • Exhaustive research, planning and consultation with essential oil (and natural healing) industry leaders.
  • An enthusiastic and supportive local market.
  • An amazing regional climate that resembles the southern French highlands (BIG leader in worldwide essential oil production). 
  • Our support network of advisors and regional economic initiatives. 
Limited product selection compared to traditional essential oil distributors may have a negative effect on sales. This is particularly relevant for our first year and pertaining to oils derived from tropical trees. In contrast, Blue Ridge Aromatics can offer some local selections that are difficult to source from traditional distributors as well as fulfill custom product requests where feasible. In addition, we are developing relationships with local retail outlets who are thrilled about stocking a local product and we'll keep the ecommerce option open should we have excess inventory.

Economics and Sustainability

Economic, environmental and social sustainability are on the forefront of our plans for Blue Ridge Aromatics. That is why we will be slowly upgrading the greenhouse to reduce our energy requirements - most notably in energy for heating. Our goal is to entirely heat the greenhouse and preheat our distillation water with a combination of solar water heating panels and a centralized high-efficiency wood boiler. We believe that within two years, we will be able to purchase this boiler and fuel it with the spent and dried feedstock from our production. The system's waste becomes its fuel. 

Asheville has been described as a Bring Your Own Job (BYOJ) community. The cost of living is relatively high while wages are low. Even the service industry is tight and it really helps to know someone. That said, Asheville is a collaborative community and the entrepreneurship scene is rather healthy. We may not be promising 100's of new jobs in a few years like New Belgium and Sierra Nevada but our vision is to leverage this region's cultural, geographic and climatic assets to gain global recognition as an authentic and innovative center of natural healing and products. We share this goal with organizations such as Venture Asheville, Blue Ridge Food Ventures, NC Natural Products Association and many others. We are also forming partnerships with natural healing schools to be an education resource (see our last perk).

What are Essential Oils Anyway?

Essential oils are concentrates of the natural aromatic components of plants. In addition to attracting beneficial organisms, these aromatic compounds make up a substantial share of the plant's natural defense system against disease and pests. Therefore, many essential oils have anti-bacterial and/or anti-fungal properties.

Essential oils are widely used in aromatherapy and the natural healing world, in baths/soaks, in diffusers for aroma, as well as in the fragrance, body/skin care and flavoring industries. Are our essential oils "therapeutic" or "clinical" grade? Yes. They are 100% pure, unadulterated, all-natural essential oils. As such, they are highly concentrated and should be used with care.

Essential oils and hydrosols are fantastic natural alternatives to plug-in and other synthetic home-freshening options. For those that are new to this world, a single drop of essential oil on a light bulb will produce a beautiful room-filling aroma for hours. Put a drop or two in your humidifier for continuous dispersal!

A secondary product of the distillation process is called hydrosol (or floral water). Hydrosol is distilled water infused with a small amount of suspended essential oil and thus with the aroma of the plant. It is often used as an undiluted spray for linens, air freshening, surface cleaning, skin care and more.

FDA Disclaimer: These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Due to their concentrated nature, pure essential oils should not be used by expecting mothers or unsupervised children. Most essential oils are too concentrated for undiluted skin application. If you intend to use these oils in a therapeutic manner, please research the species and/or consult with a natural healing practitioner.

Thanks for visiting our Indiegogo campaign!

story:
FUND THE CRUSADE TO END HOMELESSNESS!

We are committed to ending Homelessness in

America and you can help! 

CHECK OUT OUR NEW WEBSITE:

WHO ARE WE:

We are Solutions for the Homeless, a corporation, striving to be Nonprofit, located in New York, NY and dedicated to solving Homelessness in America.  We are not simply trying in help the homeless to endure their plight and status – we clearly intend to END Homelessness, with a creative solution that can only be done in America.  We need your help to complete  the task, while there is still time to save the majority of the homeless.


 

 WHAT’S THE REAL STATE OF HOMELESSNESS IN AMERICA?:

As can readily be seen in the above graphic, New York is, based on population density, one of the top five States in the U.S. experiencing grave homelessness.  The State of New York estimates that there are now approximately 59,000 Homeless individuals in NYC alone, as compared to 40,000 for the entire state, reflected in this 2010 HUD graphic.  Clearly the situation has not improved.  Obviously, a true solution, rather than life-sustaining bandaid approaches, must be achieved in order to eliminate Homelessness in America.  That is precisely what the Company is driven to accomplish.

WHAT’S OUR STRATEGY TO END HOMELESSNESS?:

Our Strategy to end Homelessness is to provide the Homeless a business of their own.  This is not employment, it is Business Ownership.  This will allow the previously homeless individual to become a self-sustained and tax-paying member of the Middle Class.  We intend to achieve this through primarily private and citizen-based contribution.  Only in America would this Strategy work.  We intend to end Homelessness – one person at a time and roll this program across the country – City by City.

WHAT’S THE SOLUTION TIMELINE?:

The Timeline for the extended, overall Project will require a multi-year effort across America.  Once the Pilot Project has been successfully completed, we will move into full-scale operations, opening facilities nationwide.  As the above graphic presents, we expect to convert 30-60 people per month in Year 1, 200 per month in Year 2 and a thousand per month in Years 3 and beyond.  Overall, the actual Timeline depends on the level and pace of Contributions – IT DEPENDS ON YOU!

WHAT’S THE FUNDING STRATEGY?:

The Funding Requirements for SFTH are significant – requiring Millions of dollars over a decade of commitment.  The strategy for early Funding Projects – specifically the Pilot in NYC – is to utilize Crowdfunding – via Indigogo – to a level of $250K and hopefully much more.  Beyond that, we anticipate, through extremely aggressive national promotion, to be able to take our case to all Americans via Cable and Broadcast Presentations.

story:
GET WET MARINE- DRY STORAGE FOR BOATS.


Hello, my name is Ashley McIver,

I am the owner of Get Wet Marine.

I have been running a marine maintenance and service business for 12 years. I am the head Marine Fitter and have trained some of the best Marine mechanics around.

I started my career in 1993 as an apprentice Fitter and Turner completing 2 years before deciding to join the Australian Army as a Fitter Armament which completed my Fitter and Turner apprenticeship and so much more. I went on to complete Tank, APC and AusLav Armament Maintenance Course's.  Then I went onto Marine Equipment Maintenance Course's. Served overseas on deployment, and was working very closely with the Australian Special Forces whilst deployed. My skill level at my job was extremely good and still is.

I started Get Wet Marine straight out of the Australian Army in my back yard, I quickly required a factory to move too. Then I had an idea for boat storage and relocated to another larger factory, but my name got around quicker than I had anticipated and the factory fast filled with boats to be serviced or repaired.

I now have had to relocate to another location due to the lease being up and building owners requiring to do maintenance to their factory. So it's time to revisit my idea of having a large factory that anyone can have their dream boat stored and cared for at one location. But this requires a lot of funding to lease a suitable large location, and install a security camera system. As well as expanding an area to 24 hour access for boat owners who go in and out at all times of the day and night.

The new factory will be located in the western suburbs of Melbourne, between Maidstone and Altona Nth.

I am offering a few boat storage lots at a heavily discounted rate.

They are as follows; these are all up to a 25 foot boats. Anyone with a boat larger than this, please add 10% to the following prices. All prices include GST.

40 boat dry storage bays for 3 months @ $60 a week for $780.00 each

40 boat dry storage bays for 6 months @ $55 a week for $1430.00 each.

40 boat dry storage bays for 12 months @ $50 a week for $2600.00 each.

20 boat dry storage bays for 24 months @ $45 a week for $4680.00 each.

These storage bays will be only accessible between our hours of operation with options for after hours pick up and drop off at an extra cost.

10 boat dry storage bays for 60 months @ $50 a week for $13000.00 each.

Only these 10 areas will be given automatic free upgrade to 24 hour access bays when they become available in approx. 12 month’s time.

All money raised will be used to create a safe and secure area for your pride and joy.

So you will be able to have the boat you want, not the boat that can only fit in your drive way or out the front yard for anyone to take or damage.

By taking this opportunity you will be saving anywhere from 25% - 50% in storage fees. Money you can put into improving your boat or getting the boat you really want.

If you don't have a boat, I'm sure you have a friend who does. So let them know. If you see a large boat outside someone's house that clearly needs a storage bay. Let them know about this great offer. You never known they may just take you out for a fishing trip just to say thank you for passing on the info that they may have never known about.

If you are interested in making any kind of donation to help me make my dream business a possibility, Please don't hesitate to donate anything you can please.

Thank you very much.

40 boat dry storage bays for 6 months @ $55 a week for $1430.00 each.
40 boat dry storage bays for 12 months @ $50 a week for $2600.00
each.
20 boat dry storage bays for 24 months @ $45 a week for $4680.00 each.
These storage bays will be only accessible between our hours of
operation with options for after hours pick up and drop off at an extra cost.
10 boat dry storage bays for 60 months @ $50 a week for $13000.00 each.
Only these 10 areas will be given automatic free upgrade to 24 hour access
bays when they become available in approx. 12 month’s time.
All money raised will be used to create a safe and secure area for your
pride and joy.
So you will be able to have the boat you want, not the boat that can only
fit in your drive way or out the front yard for anyone to take or damage.
By taking this opportunity you will be saving anywhere from 25% - 50% in
storage fees. Money you can put into improving your boat or getting the boat
you really want.
If you don't have a boat, I'm sure you have a friend who does. So let them
know. If you see a large boat outside someone's house that clearly needs a
storage bay. Let them know about this great offer. You never known they may
just take you out for a fishing trip just to say thank you for passing on the
info that they may have never known about.
If you are interested in making any kind of donation to help me make my
dream business a possibility, Please don't hesitate to donate anything you can
please. 
Thank you very much.

story:
Buy A Dad

Buy A Dad - Buy A Mom is a community-based action group working towards eliminating the practice of imprisoning parents over Child Support issues.    

Shackled criminals streaming into courtrooms throughout the United States is a common sight. Witnessing parents shackled at the waist for falling behind on Child Support is compelling.  Our funds will lead us directly into the courtrooms of Family Courts to buy back the freedom of moms and dads serving time for Child Support issues.

Your participation will not only buy back the freedom of our citizens; your participation will also raise awareness through legislative halls and assist in providing genuine information and support.   Our objective is to free indebted parents and to provide solutions to tens of thousands of parents BEFORE they are sent to our debtor prisons.

What We Need

  • Buy A Dad - Buy A Mom needs your financial/technical/research support to ensure we are successful in each phase of our campaign.
  • Reaching our goal will maximize the number of incarcerated parents released.

Understanding the Cycle and Impact

Here's a very basic illustration of  the systemic problem in the Child Support cycle:

Problems at Home (Financial Stress) --> Divorce --> Employment Issue --> Missed Child Support Payment --> Contempt of Court --> Pay Lump Sum or Go to Jail --> Go to Jail --> Child Support Payments Accrue --> Released From Jail --> Increased Child Support Debt --> Prison Record --> More Difficult to Find Work  --> Missed Child Support Payment --> Repeat Cycle.  

This system neither helps keep parents current on Child Support nor gets children the Child Support they need.  Further, this cycle is damaging to all parties involved (parents and children), and actually costs taxpayers more money throughout the process of prosecuting and then incarcerating parents for up to 180 days.

Some of the greatest impacts of our campaign may never be directly experienced by us:  an awkward meeting of the parent with child, silent contemplation of a renewed chance in life, facing the fear of failure, discovering hope and a new direction.

Here's what you will experience:

  • Our attorneys review upcoming cases and prioritize to insure non-violent, high impact cases are attended.
  • Immediate release of parents in Child Support cases.
  • Immediate funds directed to Child Support.
  • Legislative action brought to the forefront.
  • Building of a solution-oriented website for parents.
  • Development of a community-based outreach model that can be duplicated in communities across the country.
  • Ongoing case and point evaluations of our efforts.

Risks & Challenges

We will not have enough funds to free everyone.  We cannot be assured that each parent will be responsive, or even appreciate our efforts.  

  • Prices of each case will vary, but we are initiating our range at: $200-$1,000.  These funds are the "Default or Purge" payments required for their release.  These payments go directly to other parent not legal/court fees and do not eliminate other support debt.
  • The more funds we raise, the greater number of releases we can achieve and the more lives in which we can make a positive impact.

We are seeking change--not appreciation--and will work towards developing a support network that will improve each of our communities' condition.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to assist, can you help get the word out?  Or do you have a skill or resource we may be looking for?  We want to hear from you!

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are purveyors of premium Apple lifestyle accessories built on intelligent design, style, and functionality. i-Market brings together the best Apple accessories from around the world from companies that believe quality is simply more than the materials, but the total package of design, function and user experience.

OUR MISSION

Our mission is to connect the best, premium indie brands with our awesome indie-minded customers who want the best premium Apple accessories. We are committed to providing our customers with an exceptional shopping experience, product selection, and customer engagement.

WHY

The reason we started i-Market was because we weren’t finding the cool gadgets and accessories that we were seeing on popular blogs and gadget sites. So we decided to open a shop for people like ourselves.

Ever walk into a big electronics store only to walk out empty handed minutes later because they had nothing appealing to you. We know the feeling and it happens to us all the time. You just purchased that shiny new iPhone or MacBook and you want something to cover it and set it apart from everyone else's device but the store you are in doesn't have the selection you are looking for. You see 5 people walk out the door with a new phone like yours and they all bought the same case. This is the moment you come to i-Market to find that bag, case, speaker, or gadget that you wanted when you were at that “other” store.

Now, we need a little help with building i-Market into the awesome brand for premium indie Apple Lifestyle accessories.

THE TEAM

We are:

We are both avid tech, design and car enthusiast from Atlanta, GA. We both have backgrounds in retail, management and sales. We combined our professional experience with our passions for high-quality tech accessories to create i-Market. 

We've known each other for about 5 years and love working together. We both have expertise in certain areas and that's one reason we work so well together. The other reason is our passion for technology and design.

THE PERKS

$5 Thank You

Thanks for stopping by to support us!

$10 A Little More Love

Thank you for showing us a little more love! 

$25 Essentials Pack

Enter for a chance to win our Essentials Pack (retail value $100). Winner will be able to choose 1-2 items valued at $100. There will be 5 winners chosen.

$50 Gold Pack

Enter for a chance to win our Gold Pack (retail value $200). Winner will be able to choose 1-3 items valued at $200. There will be 

$100 Ultimate Pack

Enter for a chance to win our Ultimate Platinum Pack (retail value $400). Winner will be able to choose 1-5 items valued at $400. There will be 1 winner chosen.

$1000 Your Collection

You get a collection named after you, choose the product (5 items) and have it featured on our homepage. Plus, we will send you what choose for your collection.

Shipping

FREE Shipping within the U.S. 

Canada and all other International shipments are subject to $45 shipping rate.

OUR GOAL & USE OF FUNDS

We need $35,000 to help jump start our vision. We will purchase some equipment, some inventory and fulfill your perks.

Our stretched goal is $150,000. It may seem like a lot, but we want to capture the best product from around the world and bring them to our awesome customers.



PLEASE, IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS SEND US A MESSAGE AND DON'T FORGET TO SHARE! THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary


CHRIS IS CREATOR OF AFRESHWORLD. 

A HUB FOR CREATIVITY AND BUSINESS, FACILITATING GLOBAL COLLABORATION.

​ I am the visionary behind Afreshworld,which evolved out of a burning desire to create and develop creative ideas that would positively impact the world. During the process of development I was privileged  to work with many artists and organizations. This opportunity created my great purpose and passion, which is collaboration in the process of creativity and business. My professional career is that of an entrepreneur and investor. I have been an entrepreneur since the tender age of 9, out of necessity and an innate sense of ingenuity. This has been a trend even up until today. Afreshworld has developed many creative ideas and projects that we are excited to share with the world. In the spirit of Adventure and Enterprise we are using a creative fundraising method. We will use our capital to develop our headquarters, hire a support staff, legally protect our ideas and innovations,  release our creative material and support the culture!

  • We are Doing The Impossible, a Campaign to raise capital and build a network of support for Afreshworld Business Incubator

What We Need & What You Get


  • We need 10,000 Individual Supporters to Pre-Order an Afreshworld-Doing The Impossible Tee within 72 Hours
  • Forever receive Exclusive Access to our books, films, music and art.
  • Be Apart of an Epic Adventure 
  • Invitation to the private "We Did The Impossible Celebration"
  • Help us Inspire the youth with our story of creativity and resilience!

The Impact

  • By establishing Our business incubator we are creating an environment for Creativity  and Business to intersect, thereby producing good fruits to share with Our World. We are fostering the culture of Innovation and Collaboration through Creative  Entrepreneurship. We will generate good energy, tell an epic story and give the world all we've got!
  • When we achieve our Goal we will do 100 hours of Community Service this school year encouraging youth to be creative by sharing our passion and stories of possibility, challenge & resolve that have produce triumph!

Risks & Challenges

  • Challenge: We only have 72 Hours to find 10,000 Supporters!

Other Ways You Can Help


  • If you can't donate and still want to be a supporter Join our Team!
  • Promote Doing The Impossible on social media sites.
  •  Connect us with people and organizations that you know can help. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let everyone know about our vision and help us "Do The Impossible"
