story:
And if you don't know, now you know ...

This is a story about friendship, family and doing what we believe is right for the future generations, not just of Echo Park or LA or California, but of the Earth and all of its citizens  - both human and non-human. 

Mollie Engelhart and I have been friends for over ten years and our first venture, Kindkreme, began when I had my daughter Bowie. It was about family, it was about women creating something and owning something together that could be passed on to the children - first Bowie and now Rio (Mollie’s son) too. Something that was a positive contribution to the kind of  world in which we want our children to grow up.

And as it expanded,  it became the place where we served hundreds of thousands of people the kind of food we believe in, many of whom have become friends, many of whom have become family.

A couple of years after opening Kindkreme, Mollie and I found ourselves wholly in charge and calling the shots of Sage Vegan Bistro, a real organic vegan restaurant located in my favorite neighborhood in Los Angeles, Echo Park. Being part of the burgeoning food landscape in this neighborhood and offering a few more options was an honor that we did not take lightly. 

Mollie's culinary pedigree goes far beyond icekreme and dessert making. As a vegan since birth who comes from a long line of resourceful cooks (ever heard of Cafe Gratitude??) she had already been feeding people delicious humane food  since long before we met. The time between her thinking of her next dish and then executing it consisted solely of her getting to a kitchen and getting the right ingredients. And like some sort of prodigy of flavor, she always got it right. On the first try. Even if it was some meat dish that she had never even tasted in her entire life. Perfect. First try.

And what we hadn’t learned yet about running a full restaurant kitchen, we were graciously taught over time by our kitchen manager and  Mollie’s future husband  Elias Sosa, who is also something of a prodigy himself - self-taught and whip smart, with a healthy dash of humor and irreverence to make it fun. 


Nice Story (kinda long) why should you care?

And best of all, the very best part about Sage Vegan Bistro in Echo Park was YOU. Our customers. It so corny that I’m embarrassed to say that it bring tears to my eyes when I think of our customers over the years, the regulars who have rotated in and out, the regulars who have stayed, the newbies, the lunch crowd, the people who always come when they are in town.   People who don’t know this neighborhood are always surprised when I tell them stories about you guys - the generosity, the forgiveness of mistakes, the graciousness. You, the people who live here and the people who come to eat here and the way you have welcomed us from the beginning, the way you keep coming back and the way you forgive all the little idiosyncrasies of the old building and our small kitchen and sometimes spotty service. 

We are so grateful for you. We f-ing love you. And we want to create place where you don’t have to overlook those idiosyncrasies, where you don't have to wait 25 minutes to get a table for four or five and where you can ORDER A BEER! And a VEGAN PRETZEL!  And PIZZA! Where you can have a celebration with 15 people if you want or maybe just sit at the bar if you’re alone and people watch. We want to give more to the people who have given us so much over the years. 

So what EXACTLY do we want to do???

Expand, my friends! We've been trying to do this for years in various ways and the perfect opportunity came up when the pawn shop next door decided to move to a different location. We will be doing as much work as possible in the space next door while Sage Vegan Echo Park stays open and then hopefully close for a very very short period and join the two spaces in a glorious moment that is the realization of everything we've ever wanted for this beautiful restaurant. It will retain all the magical things that make it Sage Echo Park but look a little more like THIS:

We'll add another bathroom to the mix (finally, right?!) Beer and wine on tap at a bar. A BREWPUB (how cool is that?)  where we make some of our own beers and kombucha. A bar to sit  at and more tables, space, bigger kitchen so the food can come out more efficiently. Pizza and Pretzels, maybe a soft serve machine ;) …. Room for bigger parties so we don’t always have to send you across town to Culver City. 


Why SO much $$$?? 

Well, because this is gonna be expensive! And believe it or not, we’re actually only asking for less than a  THIRD of what we actually need from you guys and applying for loans for the rest. Some of the things we will be spending your hard earned money on are: 

1) The liquor license first and foremost! 

2) The architecture/design firm that will help us design the new place (we're expanding next door) and integrate it with our existing space and also facilitate and expedite all the permits we need from the city 

3) All the permits - city permits for days, some that cost a couple thousand, some that cost ten times a couple of thousand. 

4)  The contractors and electricians and plumbers and day laborers that will build everything out. 

5) All of the new equipment needed from refrigeration to the brewpub equipment to glycol lines for the beer on tap … Yay! 

What else?  A thousand other little things - this is our 4th time  (whew!) either constructing a space from scratch or building out an existing space and its not cheap. Especially not in LA. And we've learned ALOT since 2009 -  our first 600 sq foot spot in Studio City that took us a year to figure out how to get open. 

And especially, like I said, we appreciate your patience with all the funkiness of our space in the historic Jensen Recreation Center, but lately we’ve notice the restaurant has gotten ... a little too funky. Sage Echo Park is due for and deserves a little shine - so new, better tables and maybe chairs, and paint for everything and new outdoor tables and chairs, umbrellas that don't tip over, heat lamps… who knows? Upgrades!!!! Love!!

What's In it For Youuuuu?

Well, aside from all of the aforementioned coolness that an expanded Sage Echo park will offer: we've got some fun limited edition swag like stickers and beer koozies and tote bags, we've got t-shirts and hoodies, engraved growlers with a voucher for a free fill up of your favorite beer or kombucha .... and for you higher rollers, like $1000 and up, we've got discounts for LIFE ( the life of the business that is, which we hope is a very, very long time)
And ultimately, what's in it is a chance to be part of the continuing story of two women, growing family and a small business that we hope is making an important impact in the world; a positive impact for the community, for the animals, for the environment, for the future of our little ones and yours, for the immediate future of all of us. Like the tagline for our original little ice kreme shop: a chance for you to be Kind to You, Kind to the Planet. We love you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love us (or even just like us a little) give us a shoutout #moresageplease on your favorite social media outlet of choice. And check us out on Instagram too for updates on how everything is going -  @thekindsage and @mollie_engelhart

Thanks!
story_txt:
And if you don't know, now you know ... 
This is a story about friendship, family and doing what we believe is right for the future generations, not just of Echo Park or LA or California, but of the Earth and all of its citizens  - both human and non-human. 
Mollie Engelhart and I have been friends for over ten years and our first venture, Kindkreme, began when I had my daughter Bowie. It was about family, it was about women creating something and owning something together that could be passed on to the children - first Bowie and now Rio (Mollie’s son) too. Something that was a positive contribution to the kind of  world in which we want our children to grow up.


And as it expanded,  it became the place where we served hundreds of thousands of people the kind of food we believe in, many of whom have become friends, many of whom have become family.
A couple of years after opening Kindkreme, Mollie and I found ourselves wholly in charge and calling the shots of Sage Vegan Bistro, a real organic vegan restaurant located in my favorite neighborhood in Los Angeles, Echo Park. Being part of the burgeoning food landscape in this neighborhood and offering a few more options was an honor that we did not take lightly. 
Mollie's culinary pedigree goes far beyond icekreme and dessert making. As a vegan since birth who comes from a long line of resourceful cooks (ever heard of Cafe Gratitude??) she had already been feeding people delicious humane food  since long before we met. The time between her thinking of her next dish and then executing it consisted solely of her getting to a kitchen and getting the right ingredients. And like some sort of prodigy of flavor, she always got it right. On the first try. Even if it was some meat dish that she had never even tasted in her entire life. Perfect. First try.
And what we hadn’t learned yet about running a full restaurant kitchen, we were graciously taught over time by our kitchen manager and  Mollie’s future husband  Elias Sosa, who is also something of a prodigy himself - self-taught and whip smart, with a healthy dash of humor and irreverence to make it fun. 




Nice Story (kinda long) why should you care?
And best of all, the very best part about Sage Vegan Bistro in Echo Park was YOU. Our customers. It so corny that I’m embarrassed to say that it bring tears to my eyes when I think of our customers over the years, the regulars who have rotated in and out, the regulars who have stayed, the newbies, the lunch crowd, the people who always come when they are in town.   People who don’t know this neighborhood are always surprised when I tell them stories about you guys - the generosity, the forgiveness of mistakes, the graciousness. You, the people who live here and the people who come to eat here and the way you have welcomed us from the beginning, the way you keep coming back and the way you forgive all the little idiosyncrasies of the old building and our small kitchen and sometimes spotty service. 
We are so grateful for you. We f-ing love you. And we want to create place where you don’t have to overlook those idiosyncrasies, where you don't have to wait 25 minutes to get a table for four or five and where you can ORDER A BEER! And a VEGAN PRETZEL!  And PIZZA! Where you can have a celebration with 15 people if you want or maybe just sit at the bar if you’re alone and people watch. We want to give more to the people who have given us so much over the years. 


So what EXACTLY do we want to do???
Expand, my friends! We've been trying to do this for years in various ways and the perfect opportunity came up when the pawn shop next door decided to move to a different location. We will be doing as much work as possible in the space next door while Sage Vegan Echo Park stays open and then hopefully close for a very very short period and join the two spaces in a glorious moment that is the realization of everything we've ever wanted for this beautiful restaurant. It will retain all the magical things that make it Sage Echo Park but look a little more like THIS:


We'll add another bathroom to the mix (finally, right?!) Beer and wine on tap at a bar. A BREWPUB (how cool is that?)  where we make some of our own beers and kombucha. A bar to sit  at and more tables, space, bigger kitchen so the food can come out more efficiently. Pizza and Pretzels, maybe a soft serve machine ;) …. Room for bigger parties so we don’t always have to send you across town to Culver City. 


Why SO much $$$?? 
 
Well, because this is gonna be expensive! And believe it or not, we’re actually only asking for less than a  THIRD of what we actually need from you guys and applying for loans for the rest. Some of the things we will be spending your hard earned money on are: 
1) The liquor license first and foremost! 
2) The architecture/design firm that will help us design the new place (we're expanding next door) and integrate it with our existing space and also facilitate and expedite all the permits we need from the city 
3) All the permits - city permits for days, some that cost a couple thousand, some that cost ten times a couple of thousand. 
4)  The contractors and electricians and plumbers and day laborers that will build everything out. 
5) All of the new equipment needed from refrigeration to the brewpub equipment to glycol lines for the beer on tap … Yay! 
What else?  A thousand other little things - this is our 4th time  (whew!) either constructing a space from scratch or building out an existing space and its not cheap. Especially not in LA. And we've learned ALOT since 2009 -  our first 600 sq foot spot in Studio City that took us a year to figure out how to get open. 
And especially, like I said, we appreciate your patience with all the funkiness of our space in the historic Jensen Recreation Center, but lately we’ve notice the restaurant has gotten ... a little too funky. Sage Echo Park is due for and deserves a little shine - so new, better tables and maybe chairs, and paint for everything and new outdoor tables and chairs, umbrellas that don't tip over, heat lamps… who knows? Upgrades!!!! Love!!
What's In it For Youuuuu?
Well, aside from all of the aforementioned coolness that an expanded Sage Echo park will offer: we've got some fun limited edition swag like stickers and beer koozies and tote bags, we've got t-shirts and hoodies, engraved growlers with a voucher for a free fill up of your favorite beer or kombucha .... and for you higher rollers, like $1000 and up, we've got discounts for LIFE ( the life of the business that is, which we hope is a very, very long time)
And ultimately, what's in it is a chance to be part of the continuing story of two women, growing family and a small business that we hope is making an important impact in the world; a positive impact for the community, for the animals, for the environment, for the future of our little ones and yours, for the immediate future of all of us. Like the tagline for our original little ice kreme shop: a chance for you to be Kind to You, Kind to the Planet. We love you.



Other Ways You Can Help

 If you love us (or even just like us a little) give us a shoutout #moresageplease on your favorite social media outlet of choice. And check us out on Instagram too for updates on how everything is going -  @thekindsage and @mollie_engelhart
Thanks!

story:
Hello my name is Julie


and I have a dream. Like many. But it just so happens that I have 2 governmental organizations that believes and are interested in my project ( AMAAAZING ). They are both willing to finance me but I'm short on one little thing. " Seed money" indeed I do have most of what I need but still not enough. For me it's a big amount but to many it's only a couple of dollars.


So basically I'm just an ordinary girl living in Rosemont, Montreal who always had in interest in business and entrepreneur. A year ago,  all I was missing was " the idea".. but let's not get ahead..

Everything reeeally started almost 2 years ago. To be specific, on January 3    2014. On that very day, I had now found a new passion and that passion is called CROSSFIT. Indeed, on that day ..I didn't realize it... but this thing was gonna change my life ! For what it's worth ... this type of training is amazing.. Among other things, it's all about health, performances, mental fortitude, sense of accomplishment and making yourself better everyday. I truly never knew what I was made of until then.  BUT WHY ?? well .. in order to really focus on my performances I started to look on ways of eating so.. diets. Then, one day I stumbled across the PALEO diet.

Fair enough.. all good.. Used by many top athletes in crossfit OR to others more like a guideline....humm.... " guideline" very interesting... SO basically I had just then forevermore combined my long love for food and my new found ( couple of months into it ) love for CROSSFIT. ( Music from heaven ) :) Then on is was " cake" .. not literately .. (NO CAKE FOR ME ) and so on.. cooking.....pinterest recipes... food and health documentary.. this really is a passion.. can't stop learning and won't stop... Not to forget my best friend .. INSTAGRAM ...so yes.. meals pictures with #PALEOISH and #eattoperform, #foodismyreligion and #crossfitadd...yeah ... look me up on INSTAGRAM if you want ...j0ulie18 :)

Moving on..

Here I am.. a year or so later.. with a complete and functional business plan that caught the interest of many in the making and on an everyday basis is so close of making it happen !!

Because the "paleo" diet is not a super known way of eating. When the subject comes.. I have found myself to be a true advocate of the Paleo diet and not to forget crossfit.. yeah yeah.. Of course I need to talk about it !!.. it's my everyday reality and the very core of my business plan.. after all.. it all started in the gym.  #betteryourself :)

Details...


So.. Nowadays, with all that publicity with obesity crisis and unhealthy habits of the general population, I, want to make a difference by introducing this type of restaurant where anyone with a concern for what they eat will not be a problem and where healthy doesn't rime with vegetarian food ( no offense ). Indeed, for those who doesn't know ...the paleo diet is basically eating what is "ready to eat" or what they like to call...the "cavemen diet" ...so we are talking about meats, vegetables, fruits, nuts and seeds. Don't worry it doesn't have to be raw.. BUT it is better to eat raw veggies to keep most of the nutrients.. but you probably knew that already.. GOOD.

That type  of diet is also known to be one of the best to improve sports performances, lose extra weight and it's also known to help with inflammatory diseases like arthritis and asthma... and more. So to eat PALEO you eliminate refined sugars, grains, legumes, dairy and any process food. 


Soooo PALEO'ISH ?? really ?

yes yes... still healthy.. More " mainstream" we use some ingredients that are not "primal" that's the "ISH" part... I THOUGHT IT WAS GENIOUS.... Makes the process nicer and easier because.. after all " strict" paleo can be monotone and booooring. I want to explore.. reinvent...endless possibilities of ingenious combinations of flavors...MIX AND MATCH menu.....okay... getting carried away :P What I'm saying is that I REALLY LOVE FOOD !!!

I am looking to be the destination for people ... like me .. who likes to eat good stuff and that sometimes feels like going out to eat is your " night out "  because after all... When you are committed 100 % to a sport, elite athlete or not... the only thing you really do for fun is train, relax and eat lots of food :) #gainz ( my opinion)... I'm such a dork. 


Okidoo..so...I have design the space with practically only a big bar.. because I want my people close ;). The service ( my professional background ) is very important and I intent to make it spot less. Furthermore, to do a little wink wink at my crossfit people or ANY kind of people that has an active lifestyle, the restaurant will have little insertions of " gym" equipment.. for more details, you will need to visit :P

Truthfully, all I really want to do is cook all day long and feed people.. after all.. What makes me happy on a daily basis is exactly that; Cooking, feeding my loved ones.. and lifting heavy weights at the gym.


"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give"-

Winston Churchill


Thank you for time and hopefully for your help. I have officially poured my heart out.


Please SHARE.. who knows.. it might actually work.


For contact

julie.paleoish@gmail.com


P.S To get the perks you need to give 25$ but you don't have to give that much !

story:
Have you ever entered a place and knew it was worth protecting?

That's how we feel about our "Barn".

This building was built in 1834 of hand-hewn virgin oak. It was actually a real barn with animals and farm equipment. In 1927 our club purchased the "barn" and renovated it into a meeting place. The wagon wheels, oxen yokes and old lanterns were saved and converted into light fixtures. The animal stalls and barn floor became our kitchen and dining room. The hay loft was converted into a unique meeting space, complete with a stage. The original beams and wood are showcased throughout the building. 

In 1975 our barn was declared a historical landmark. (We think it's pretty special too). 

What do we do with our barn?

Let's start by telling you about our mission: "To develop the interests of the members in the welfare of the community through the promotion of gardening, civic and educational progress, and social life". 

We also have a Conservation Pledge: "I give my pledge as an American to save and faithfully defend from waste, the natural resources of my country, its soil and minerals, its forests, water, and wildlife."

The building is the home of the Penn Hebron Garden Club. Founded in 1921 by Mrs. Harry Morrow, a member of a pioneer family in our area, the goal of the club was to beautify the community. Throughout the years our activities have changed. 

Currently we promote our mission in a number of ways. In the spring and fall months we host a free concert series. (That's right - FREE!) Every Wednesday musicians come and perform. We also host some talks throughout the year on a variety on subjects. We have provided free and discounted meeting spaces for non-profit organizations. We also make donations to local charities almost every month! 

We have big plans to feature more community art, education, conservation, and (of course) gardening! We want to be a vital part of the revitalization of our community. 

This is where we need your help. In order to offer all of these great things, we need to take care of our Barn. We can't do it alone. Please consider donating to help us accomplish our preservation goals - including:

- Maintaining our roof 

- Making our bathrooms more ADA compliant

- Having a safe parking lot

- Safe sidewalks (which are utilized by the local community to safety walk down our busy street)

Every penny counts for our club. Can we count on you to help us keep this historic site safe and vibrant?


Thank you & God Bless.

story:
Review - Breve Rese

Martín is a 6 years old Colombian boy, passionate about car racing and karting. He has been practicing this discipline for a year and a half where his performance has been outstanding, proving a lot of passion and dedication as he must travel long distances every month by car, in order to practice and race, since the nearest track is in the city of Bogotá 400 Km away.

Martín es un pequeño COLOMBIANO de 6 años de edad, apasionado del automovilismo y el kartismo. Lleva un año y medio practicando esta disciplina donde se ha destacado, demostrando mucha pasión y entrega, ya que tiene que viajar largas jornadas por mes vía terrestre para poder practicar y correr, pues la pista más cercana está a 400 km, en Bogotá.

Since he met karting, he became a very happy child. He discovered his passion. Nowadays he is racing the 3 existing karting championships in Colombia: ROTAX MAX CHALLENGE, EASYTK and ROK CUP, in the BABY division. Martín dreams about one day, racing in the FORMULA 1 championship. His biggest idols in car racing are: Ayrton Senna, Juan Pablo Montoya and Fernando Alonso. He says: “I’ll be better than them when I grow up, right daddy?”

Desde que conoció el karting, se ha convertido en un niño mucho más feliz. Descubrió su pasión. Actualmente corre los 3 campeonatos que existen en Colombia: ROTAX MAX CHALLENGE, EASYTK y ROK CUP, en la categoría BABY. Martín sueña con correr algún día en la F1. Sus mayores ídolos en el automovilismo son: Ayrton Senna, Juan Pablo Montoya y Fernando Alonso. Y dice: "Cuando sea grande voy a ser mejor que ellos ¿Verdad papi?"

With this campaign we want to get an economic boost to be able to cover the expenses of Martín’s sports project, and be able to race in the EASYKART WORLD KARTING CHAMPIONSHIP to be held in Lignano Sabbiadoro, ITALY.

Con esta campaña queremos lograr un impulso económico para poder solventar el proyecto deportivo de Martín y poder correr el MUNDIAL DE KARTISMO EASYKART que se celebrará en Lignano Sabbiadoro, ITALIA.

With your help, we will be able to take our son to the old continent and represent his country, Colombia. Carrying the flag of Colombian Karting in his hands.

Con tu ayuda, podremos lograr que nuestro pequeñín viaje al viejo continente y represente a su país, Colombia. Llevando en sus manos las banderas del kartismo colombiano.

¡COME AND DREAM WITH MARTÍN! 

¡VEN A SOÑAR CON MARTÍN! 


What we need - Lo que necesitamos

The total expenses for the trip to the EASYKART WORLD KARTING CHAMPIONSHIP in ITALY is USD $ 15.000, to be invested as follows: 

Necesitamos un total de $15.000 USD para poder ir al mundial de ITALIA, que serán usados de la siguiente manera:

 Flying tickets for 3 people (Mom, Dad and Martín) 
BOGOTA - VENICE roundtrip $2.800 USD  
Pasajes aéreos para 3 personas (Mamá, Papá y Martín) 
BOGOTA - VENECIA ida y regreso: $2.800 USD

10 days accommodation for 3 people in Lignano (Mom, Dad and Martín)
Total: $1.500 USD 
Hotel para 3 personas en LIGNANO por 10 días (Mamá, Papá y Martín)
Total alojamiento: $1.500 USD 

 10 days Medical Insurance for 3 people  
Total: $200 USD 
Seguro médico para 3 personas por 10 días 
Total del seguro: $200 USD  

10 days car rental  
Total: $700 USD 
Renta de vehículo por 10 días 
Valor total: $700 USD  10 

days meals for 3 people (Mom, Dad and Martín) 
Total: $1.900 USD 
Alimentación por 10 días (Mamá, Papá y Martín) 
Valor total: $1.900 USD 

Equipment shipment and handle (Kart, engine, tools and others)
BOGOTA - LIGNANO - BOGOTA 
Total: $3.000 USD 
Traslado de equipos (Herramientas, kart, motor y demás)  
BOGOTA a LIGNANO y LIGNANO a BOGOTA 
Valor total: $3.000 USD 

Pits crew fee for 3 mechanics and 1 instructor 
Total: $2.500 USD 
Pago a 3 mecánicos y 1 preparador 
Valor total: $2.500 USD 

Homologated uniform and protection equipment  
Uniformes y protecciones homologadas
 Karting Suit: $600 USD 
Rib Extreme Impact Protection: $350 USD 
Shoes/Zapatillas: $150 USD Helmet: $1.300 USD  

What you receive - Lo que obtienes

We offer perks that generate more support for our champion, you can fashion and wear them anytime you want.

Ofrecemos recompensas que generan más apoyo para nuestro campeón, ya que puedes lucirlas y usarlas cada vez que quieras.

MTN21 Official Shirt - USD $500 + Shopping and Handling
Camisa oficial MTN21 - $500 USD + envío

Hi-tech shirt with our little racing driver Martín’s local sponsors logo embroidered. Your name (or your company’s name) can also be part of the shirt you order. Available in all sizes, kids and adults.

Camisa de alta calidad con bordados de los patrocinadores locales de nuestro pequeño piloto Martín.Tu nombre (o el de tu empresa) tambien podrá hacer parte de la camiseta para tu envío. Disponible en todas las tallas, niños y adultos.



MTN21 Official Hat - USD $100 + Shopping and Handling
Gorra oficial MTN21 - $100 USD + envío

Hi-tech hat with our little racing driver Martín’s official logo. Available in all sizes, kids and adults. 

Gorra de alta calidad con logo oficial de nuestro pequeño piloto Martín. Disponible en todas las tallas, niños y adultos.


Your Name in my Uniform - USD $1.000
Tu nombre en mi uniforme - $1.000 USD

Your name (or your company’s name) will be embroidered as a SPONSOR in the racing uniform (karting suit) that Martín will use during all through the 2016 season. It will appear in all publishings and advertising.

Tu nombre (o el de tu empresa) irá bordado como PATROCINADOR en el uniforme de carreras que usará Martín por toda la temporada 2016. Aparecerá en todas las publicaciones y pautas publicitarias.

¡SUPPORT US! 
¡APÓYANOS! 


The Impact - El impacto

With your contribution, Martín will be ale to be a successful racing driver and you will always be part of his process through our social networks. 

Con tu contribución, Martín podrá ser un automovilista exitoso y siempre serás parte su proceso a través de redes sociales. 



    Founds - Los fondos

    In case we don’t accomplish our goal, the money we collect will be use for regular expenses during all three National Championships that Martín races. It will be use for trips, inscriptions, mechanics, uniforms, tyres, meals, and all other needs to continue in the process.  

    Si no logramos la meta, el dinero recaudado será usado en los gastos regulares de los tres campeonatos nacionales que corre Martín. Servirá para los viajes, inscripciones, mecánicos, uniformes, llantas, alimentación y demás necesidades para continuar en el proceso. fundacion marianella o marteam.....

    Other ways to help
    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

    Help us publicise our campaign and accomplish our goals. Tell your friends and family that together we can make the dream of little 6 year old Martín come true.

    Ayúdanos a divulgar nuestra campaña y lograr la meta que nos propusimos. Coméntale a tus amigos y conocido que todos juntos podemos hacer realidad el sueño de el pequeño Martín de 6 años.


    What if a miracle happens and we get to A MILLION?¿Y si ocurre un milagro y logramos UN MILLÓN?

    If we receive a massive support and we get to a big amount of money, like a million dollars. We will build the first karting track on eastern Colombia. Since there is none, and our little champion must travel 400 Km in order to train, and in that way we will incentivise the practice of karting on vulnerable children in this area, trough the Foundation created by Martín’s parents for those matters.

    Si logramos un apoyo masivo y conseguimos una gran cantidad de dinero, como un millón de dólares. Construiremos el primer kartódromo del oriente de Colombia. Ya que no existe ninguno y nuestro pequeño campeón debe viajar 400 km para poder entrenar, y de esta manera incentivaremos la practica del kartismo en la niñez vulnerable de este sector, a través de la fundación creada por los padres de Martín para tal fin.

    It will be THE BEST KARTING TRACK IN THE COUNTRY. It will be named "Martín Ramírez MotorPark" and we will have a photography hall with pictures of every single person that made their contribution to make it true.

    Será EL MEJOR KARTÓDROMO DEL PAÍS. Llevará el nombre de "Martín Ramírez MotorPark", y tendremos un hall con fotografías de todos y cada uno de los que aportaron su granito de arena para lograrlo.

    It will be a 1.200 meters track with the best technical official characteristics.

    Serán 1.200m de pista, con las mejores características técnicas oficiales.
story_txt:
Review - Breve Rese 
Martín is a 6 years old Colombian boy, passionate about car racing and karting. He has been practicing this
discipline for a year and a half where his performance has been outstanding, proving a lot of passion and
dedication as he must travel long distances every month by car, in order to practice and race, since the nearest
track is in the city of Bogotá 400 Km away.


Martín es un pequeño COLOMBIANO de 6 años de edad, apasionado del automovilismo y el kartismo. Lleva
un año y medio practicando esta disciplina donde se ha destacado, demostrando mucha pasión y entrega, ya
que tiene que viajar largas jornadas por mes vía terrestre para poder practicar y correr, pues la pista más
cercana está a 400 km, en Bogotá.

Since he met karting, he became a very happy child. He discovered his passion. Nowadays he is racing the 3 existing karting
championships in Colombia: ROTAX MAX CHALLENGE, EASYTK and ROK CUP, in the BABY division.
Martín dreams about one day, racing in the FORMULA 1 championship. His biggest idols in car racing are:
Ayrton Senna, Juan Pablo Montoya and Fernando Alonso. He says: “I’ll be better than them when I grow up,
right daddy?”

Desde que conoció el karting, se ha convertido en un niño mucho más feliz. Descubrió su pasión. Actualmente corre los 3 campeonatos
que existen en Colombia: ROTAX MAX CHALLENGE, EASYTK y ROK CUP, en la categoría BABY.
Martín sueña con correr algún día en la F1. Sus mayores ídolos en el automovilismo son: Ayrton Senna, Juan
Pablo Montoya y Fernando Alonso. Y dice: "Cuando sea grande voy a ser mejor que ellos ¿Verdad papi?"

With this campaign we want to get an economic boost to be able to cover the expenses of Martín’s sports
project, and be able to race in the EASYKART WORLD KARTING CHAMPIONSHIP to be held in Lignano
Sabbiadoro, ITALY.

Con esta campaña queremos lograr un impulso económico para poder solventar el proyecto deportivo de
Martín y poder correr el MUNDIAL DE KARTISMO EASYKART que se celebrará en Lignano Sabbiadoro,
ITALIA.

With your help, we will be able to take our son to the old continent and represent his country, Colombia.
Carrying the flag of Colombian Karting in his hands.

Con tu ayuda, podremos lograr que nuestro pequeñín viaje al viejo continente y represente a su país,
Colombia. Llevando en sus manos las banderas del kartismo colombiano.

¡COME AND DREAM WITH MARTÍN! 
¡VEN A SOÑAR CON MARTÍN! 



   What we need - Lo que necesitamos
  







The total expenses for the trip to the EASYKART WORLD KARTING
CHAMPIONSHIP in ITALY is USD $ 15.000, to be invested as follows: 
Necesitamos un total de $15.000 USD para poder ir al mundial de ITALIA, que
serán usados de la siguiente manera: 
 Flying tickets for 3 people (Mom, Dad and Martín) BOGOTA - VENICE roundtrip $2.800 USD  Pasajes aéreos para 3 personas (Mamá, Papá y Martín) BOGOTA - VENECIA ida y regreso: $2.800 USD





10 days accommodation for 3 people in Lignano (Mom, Dad and Martín)Total: $1.500 USD Hotel para 3 personas en LIGNANO por 10 días (Mamá, Papá y Martín) Total alojamiento: $1.500 USD 





 10 days Medical Insurance for 3 people  Total: $200 USD Seguro médico para 3 personas por 10 días Total del seguro: $200 USD  
10 days car rental  Total: $700 USD Renta de vehículo por 10 días Valor total: $700 USD  10 
days meals for 3 people (Mom, Dad and Martín) Total: $1.900 USD Alimentación por 10 días (Mamá, Papá y Martín) Valor total: $1.900 USD 
Equipment shipment and handle (Kart, engine, tools and others)BOGOTA - LIGNANO - BOGOTA Total: $3.000 USD Traslado de equipos (Herramientas, kart, motor y demás)  BOGOTA a LIGNANO y LIGNANO a BOGOTA Valor total: $3.000 USD 
Pits crew fee for 3 mechanics and 1 instructor Total: $2.500 USD Pago a 3 mecánicos y 1 preparador Valor total: $2.500 USD 
Homologated uniform and protection equipment  Uniformes y protecciones homologadas Karting Suit: $600 USD Rib Extreme Impact Protection: $350 USD Shoes/Zapatillas: $150 USD Helmet: $1.300 USD  


What you receive - Lo que obtienes
 






We offer perks that generate more support for our champion, you can fashion and wear them anytime you
want.

Ofrecemos recompensas que generan más apoyo para nuestro campeón, ya que puedes lucirlas y usarlas cada
vez que quieras.



MTN21 Official Shirt - USD $500 + Shopping and HandlingCamisa oficial MTN21 - $500 USD + envío
Hi-tech shirt with our little racing driver Martín’s local sponsors logo embroidered. Your name (or your company’s name) can also be part of the shirt you order. Available in all sizes, kids and adults.Camisa de alta calidad con bordados de los patrocinadores locales de nuestro pequeño piloto Martín.Tu nombre (o el de tu empresa) tambien podrá hacer parte de la camiseta para tu envío. Disponible en todas las tallas, niños y adultos.




MTN21 Official Hat - USD $100 + Shopping and HandlingGorra oficial MTN21 - $100 USD + envío




Hi-tech hat with our little racing driver Martín’s official logo. Available in all sizes, kids and adults. 



Gorra de 
alta calidad con logo oficial de nuestro 
pequeño piloto Martín. Disponible en todas las tallas, niños y adultos.



Your Name in my Uniform - USD $1.000Tu nombre en mi uniforme - $1.000 USD








Your name (or your company’s name) will be embroidered as a SPONSOR in the racing uniform (karting
suit) that Martín will use during all through the 2016 season. It will appear in all publishings and advertising.
Tu nombre (o el de tu empresa) irá bordado como PATROCINADOR en el uniforme de carreras que usará
Martín por toda la temporada 2016. Aparecerá en todas las publicaciones y pautas publicitarias.
¡SUPPORT US! ¡APÓYANOS! 




The Impact - El impacto 






With your contribution, Martín will be ale to be a successful racing driver and you will always be part of his
process through our social networks. 
Con tu contribución, Martín podrá ser un automovilista exitoso y siempre serás parte su proceso a través de
redes sociales. 




    

Founds - Los fondos





In case we don’t accomplish our goal, the money we collect will be use for regular expenses during all three
National Championships that Martín races. It will be use for trips, inscriptions, mechanics, uniforms, tyres,
meals, and all other needs to continue in the process.  



Si no logramos la meta, el dinero recaudado será usado en los gastos regulares de los tres campeonatos nacionales que corre Martín. Servirá para los viajes, inscripciones, mecánicos, uniformes, llantas, alimentación y demás necesidades para continuar en el proceso. fundacion marianella o marteam.....
  Other ways to helpOtras formas en las que puedes ayudar 





Help us publicise our campaign and accomplish our goals. Tell your friends and family that together we can
make the dream of little 6 year old Martín come true.



Ayúdanos a divulgar nuestra campaña y lograr la meta que nos propusimos. Coméntale a tus amigos y conocido que todos juntos podemos hacer realidad el sueño de el pequeño Martín de 6 años.
  What if a miracle happens and we get to A MILLION?¿Y si ocurre un milagro y logramos UN MILLÓN?
 




If we receive a massive support and we get to a big amount of money, like a million dollars. We will build the
first karting track on eastern Colombia. Since there is none, and our little champion must travel 400 Km in
order to train, and in that way we will incentivise the practice of karting on vulnerable children in this area,
trough the Foundation created by Martín’s parents for those matters.
Si logramos un apoyo masivo y conseguimos una gran cantidad de dinero, como un millón de dólares.
Construiremos el primer kartódromo del oriente de Colombia. Ya que no existe ninguno y nuestro pequeño
campeón debe viajar 400 km para poder entrenar, y de esta manera incentivaremos la practica del kartismo en
la niñez vulnerable de este sector, a través de la fundación creada por los padres de Martín para tal fin.

It will be THE BEST KARTING TRACK IN THE COUNTRY. It will be named "Martín Ramírez
MotorPark" and we will have a photography hall with pictures of every single person that made their
contribution to make it true.

Será EL MEJOR KARTÓDROMO DEL PAÍS. Llevará el nombre de "Martín Ramírez MotorPark", y
tendremos un hall con fotografías de todos y cada uno de los que aportaron su granito de arena para lograrlo.

It will be a 1.200 meters track with the best technical official characteristics.
Serán 1.200m de pista, con las mejores características técnicas oficiales.

story:
Support the new concept - You Pick Pub

I've been looking to diversify my business interests by opening a bar, and I think I've come up with the perfect idea.  I already have the 3 way liquor license for Marion County in Indiana secured, and have a location available which is convenient to Indianapolis's west side, Avon, and Brownsburg areas.  You Pick Pub is a tie in with the concept, as well as the common problem of "Where do you want to go...?"  I don't know, You Pick!".   

Looking to fund the build out of this awesome idea.  I've spoken with many local pub crawlers who enjoy their beer, and a few friends of mine already in the industry, and every one of them has said they love this idea.  (While I'm not currently in the bar/service industry, I have 5 years restaurant experience and worked for 4 years as the entertainment in various bars around Central Indiana, and have several people currently in the bar/pub industry helping me out.)

I've heard of places like this... but never in the Midwest and certainly not in Indiana.  

  • You walk into You Pick Pub, and prepay an amount to your server which is loaded onto an RFID card.
  • You proceed to the "Wall of Beer", offering 15 to 20 changing draft options. 
  • Tap your RFID Card on the reader, and pour your perfect beer.
  • Since the system charges by the ounce, you can try a little of each, or get a full glass of your favorite!
  • The system limits each Beer Connoisseur for safety, just see your server to get a reset 
  • We can also put various wines on tap for those who don't care for beer!

We would also be offering a full bar, with specialty drinks and some unique shots.  The food menu would initially consist of custom made pizza, various BBQ options, and "build your own nachos".  The food menu is designed to grow and change over time as customers give us input.

We are working on a video to post for the campaign, so that's coming soon.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Build out of the "Beer Wall" is expected to cost nearly $25,000 USD.  We are seeking $30,000 USD minimum to help cover any unexpected expenses.  I will be putting my own time and money into the build as well to complete the rest of the bar.  I'm simply looking for support in order to do the "Beer Wall" which was not part of my initial business plan, but is way too awesome an idea not to try for.  Should we exceed the expected goal, it will only make this place that much more awesome.

  • $30,000 USD in funding requested for Beer Wall Build
  • Donor's who donates $100 or more will receive a specially designed "You Pick Pub" Supporter T-Shirt, and a credit good towards your first visit.  
  • Anyone donating $1000 or more will receive a "You Pick Pub" Founder polo shirt, a credit good towards your first visit, and will be immortalized on a permanent plaque prominently placed in You Pick Pub above the Beer Wall for all to see!
  • Anyone donating $2500 or more will have a tap on the beer wall named for them, as well as receive the Polo Shirt and a credit good on their first visit.
  • If we do not reach our goal, All funds will still go toward the intended purpose, I will simply have to seek the remaining funds elsewhere.

The Impact

Donating to this campaign will allow me to open up a fun place for people to gather friends together and enjoy each others company.

  • This project will bring value to the local community.
  • I've been an entrepreneur for over 10 years and have seen success in my other buisnesses, and with the large amount of research I've put into this, I am very confident in it's potential.
  • For questions or concerns I'll be happy to communicate with you directly.

Risks & Challenges

Overall risk is minimal, as I'm essentially taking an existing bar, moving it to a better location down the street, and revamping it with the new concept.  

  • Estimated 60 to 90 day total build out including custom building and install of equipment.
  • Most of the details are already sorted and planned, and any other challenges that come up will be addressed quickly and efficiently.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you cannot contribute financially.  Here are a few other ways you can help!

  • Get involved, spread the message, let others know about this fundraising campaign.
  • If you have any special skills that you feel might help us to complete the project quicker or more efficiently, or if you have any other input please feel free to contact me.

Thank you very much for your time and your consideration in donating to this campaign.  We're looking forward to watching you make your first perfect pour.

story:
Short Summary

After being in the telecommunications industry as an union non-management employee for over 15 years, I have been unsuccessful in being promoted into management. After completing a Bachelors, MBA, and Master of Science degrees and trying to get promoted to management for over 4 years, I finally decided to live for myself and pursue my dreams. I became comfortable with having a union job, but I decided I needed more. I decided to not give up another 15 years of my life for a job, pension plan and retirement. I wanted more in life; I wanted a career I enjoyed. I want to be a good example to my teenage daughter. I would be a hypocrite to tell her to pursue her dreams, and I don't practice what I preach. I want to lead by example. 

Music has always been my first love, so I decided to submit my severance request, go back to college to complete my Music Business & Entrepreneurship degree. I will focus on voice and piano for the music portion of my degree. It has been over 20 years since I pursued a degree in music, but I know this is what I want to do. I am starting a music blog, will have a radio show on Deep Ellum On Air internet radio based on my blog, and start a management & consulting company. I am starting with a 2 hour show on every Thursday. My goal is to start the show before the end of October. 

What I Need & What You Get

Even though I have submitted my severance request, it takes time for the process to complete its course. My original plan was to use part of my severance as a business investment, but that plan has stalled. I am also paying cash for my college education and books, which is costly. Networking has paid off, and I have been getting opportunities to participate in events and possible management and representation of some independent artists. I do not want to conduct any business until I trademark my business name and logo. So before I start my blog, business website, radio show, and print any business cards, I need to have the name and logo trademark protected. I have already purchased the domain name for the business website and blog. Contributions will help me obtain the following:

  • Monthly marketing of blog & radio show
  • Marketing products - T-shirts, tote bags, sweatshirts, brochures, banner, etc. (Products will be available for purchase & gifts at events.)
  • Trademark application fees
  • Attorney (I will need to secure an attorney to handle the complicated trademark application process & create contracts once business relationships are created.)
  • Radio show fees (I am responsible for fees for my time slot & show producing fees.)
  • Business insurance (down payment and first 3 month premium payment) - I want to protect my business and investment, so I am obtaining Home-based business insurance and professional liability insurance. My renters policy does not cover aspects of my home-based insurance.
  • Office supplies & expenses
*********************************UPDATE***********************************
THE OFFICIAL LOGO FOR CLEFOLOGY LIFE!!!


The Impact

I am starting to make some solid connections within the industry, and I want to use the wisdom and education I gained over the years to help other people reach their greatest potential. My music blog will document my journey in pursuing my music dream, lessons learned, and feature independent artists and their music. I am open to all genres of music, since the music language is universal and multicultural. Artists that are featured on the blog will be guests on the radio show. I will also utilize my event planning skills to plan and promote any events the artists would like to have locally, with the potential to grow globally. I want to help people by providing support, a listening ear, and advice to help them pursue their dreams. If I can help one person, then everything I have endured was not in vain. 


Risks & Challenges

I have received some criticism from some people because I have a daughter that is college bond (she is in the 11th grade), student loans, and I am the sole financial provider. I overcame abuse, rejection, severe depression, post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and homelessness. I have lost everything and had to start over. I have become a stronger woman, mother, sister, daughter, educator, and friend. I am scared about moving to the next level in my destiny, but I don't have fear about the future anymore (there is a difference). When I allowed fear to take over, I was stuck and did not move at all. Once I moved past the fear, I became scared about the future. Even though I am scared, I am still pushing through adversities and issues to move to the next level. I do not know what the future holds, but I am definitely enjoying the journey. 

If You are Not Able to Donate,  Here Are Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign with your business associates, friends,and family and ask them to make a contribution!
  • Please share the link for my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc. 

Thank You For Your Support!

story:
My Dream:


In January of 2010 after finding myself out of work in my field as a Horticulturist, I saw that I had to find another means of supporting myself and I'd had every kind of job one could do. From retail sales, food management, medical records and data entry and I hated going to them, every day. I looked at where I was in my life and living in my best friends garage with my things in storage after an unsuccessful move to San Francisco, I watched a PBS documentary on small business. 

This woman's story was touching. She had been left with several children by her husband and found herself unemployed with no job experience or job history and no professed job skills. She was in crisis trying to keep the family home and support herself and her family and she was determined to do SOMETHING . She could bake. Everyone loved her cookies and told her she should open a business but she was skeptical. She gave it a whirl and at the end of the documentary she introduced herself  and said: "My name is Mrs. Fields" and stated if she could do what she had done anyone could. 

I was captivated and motivated and I opened my small online business selling T-shirts. I don't know where the idea came from but after months of researching how to open a small business, resources, suppliers, how to build a website and where to go to get the paperwork needed and filed to do so I launched the online store. I then started attending local events, fairs, festivals and flea markets and I experienced enough success to support myself and my family. 

Almost 6 years later I have found myself in the position with the opportunity to have a retail location, but my funds have run dry. I had no capital or cash flow to open the business. I began with an unemployment check and threw my profits back into the business taking big risks the whole way.  I have gone from my small beginning to where I am now on my work ethic and support of family, friends and the community and my determination to make it work. Now, I simply need help to cover expenses and the costs of growth into my retail shoes and I am so close.  

What We Need & What You Get

The funds of 7500 will allow me to catch up with what I am behind and give me what I need to be able to open the retail store here and continue my dream. If I can manege, with your help, all additional funds will go toward buying a DTG (Direct to Garment ) printer which will be revolutionary to my business and allow me to truly compete in this  market. The initial cost of $10,000 - $20,000 will pay for itself the first year to maybe two years at most. I am offering certain "perks" small as they may be to contributors and also with each contribution I hope you will follow my journey and share, as I intend to share and help and encourage others in this arena. I believe everyone can and does make a difference and I hope to be able to offer classes at some point in screen printing for fun at home for anyone that is interested and to be a spokesperson for other artists and entrepreneurs. I hope to grow my small business resources site where I collect information, links and tools for small business ownees. I believe I can make it with your help and I am humbly asking you for your support. 

The Impact

With your support I will be able to keep the retail space I have come into and update my equipment to make a transition as this industry moves in time with the digital age and moves away from traditional screen printing. I can overcome this obstacle and with funding to grow and update my equipment I can compete in a larger market with Direct To Garment printing as screen printing is becoming a lost art and is expensive compared to DTG printing.. The equipment to make this transition is expensive outright but will pay for itself in short order as my costs will lower over 60%  per garment and it opens up the ability to do truly custom orders, even single ones  ON DEMAND, MADE TO ORDER! This is huge!!

Risks & Challenges

Of course there is risk involved in this move. There is always risk that the business will fail or not make enough to support itself but I believe I can make it with your help and support now and in times to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may think you just can't help because you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can  get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can  share, post and engage a larger audience via Social Media and word of mouth. Everything helps and you can use these tools and Indiegogo share tools to do so. 
  • I need your help and your support! Every time you share this campaign, post it and help to make others aware you are spreading the word and that helps give us exposure to those who can contribute, who will share further and helps bring us a step closer to reaching our goals and hence achieving 'the dream'. You can make a difference and I hope that I myself and Hot mess T-shirts can in turn propagate the giving and help others meet their dreams. I believe with every fiber of my being that we can change the world - not just in the small ways like helping small businesses succeed but globally can change the way people think. Through showing we care and are at least willing, even if not able to contribute financially, to take action we can spread joy and propagate good will, camaraderie and in turn we can change the future not just for one but change the world. I hope you believe that too. That is the first step. 
Thank you for reading this from the bottom of my heart and please take time to consider this not just here and now for me and for my campaign but every day and it is the small things that make the difference. Small embers of hope can grow to become big flames of change. A wise person told me that, and even though we have lost each other in the crowd, she was right.
story_txt:
My Dream:
 In January of 2010 after finding myself out of work in my field as a Horticulturist, I saw that I had to find another means of supporting myself and I'd had every kind of job one could do. From retail sales, food management, medical records and data entry and I hated going to them, every day. I looked at where I was in my life and living in my best friends garage with my things in storage after an unsuccessful move to San Francisco, I watched a PBS documentary on small business. 
This woman's story was touching. She had been left with several children by her husband and found herself unemployed with no job experience or job history and no professed job skills. She was in crisis trying to keep the family home and support herself and her family and she was determined to do SOMETHING . She could bake. Everyone loved her cookies and told her she should open a business but she was skeptical. She gave it a whirl and at the end of the documentary she introduced herself  and said: "My name is Mrs. Fields" and stated if she could do what she had done anyone could. 
I was captivated and motivated and I opened my small online business selling T-shirts. I don't know where the idea came from but after months of researching how to open a small business, resources, suppliers, how to build a website and where to go to get the paperwork needed and filed to do so I launched the online store. I then started attending local events, fairs, festivals and flea markets and I experienced enough success to support myself and my family. 
Almost 6 years later I have found myself in the position with the opportunity to have a retail location, but my funds have run dry. I had no capital or cash flow to open the business. I began with an unemployment check and threw my profits back into the business taking big risks the whole way.  I have gone from my small beginning to where I am now on my work ethic and support of family, friends and the community and my determination to make it work. Now, I simply need help to cover expenses and the costs of growth into my retail shoes and I am so close.     What We Need & What You Get The funds of 7500 will allow me to catch up with what I am behind and give me what I need to be able to open the retail store here and continue my dream. The equipment to make this transition is expensive outright but will pay for itself in short order as my costs will lower over 60%  per garment and it opens up the ability to do truly custom orders, even single ones  ON DEMAND, MADE TO ORDER! This is huge!!

You can  share, post and engage a larger audience via Social Media and word of mouth. Everything helps and you can use these tools and Indiegogo share tools to do so. 
I need your help and your support! Every time you share this campaign, post it and help to make others aware you are spreading the word and that helps give us exposure to those who can contribute, who will share further and helps bring us a step closer to reaching our goals and hence achieving 'the dream'. You can make a difference and I hope that I myself and Hot mess T-shirts can in turn propagate the giving and help others meet their dreams. I believe with every fiber of my being that we can change the world - not just in the small ways like helping small businesses succeed but globally can change the way people think. Through showing we care and are at least willing, even if not able to contribute financially, to take action we can spread joy and propagate good will, camaraderie and in turn we can change the future not just for one but change the world. I hope you believe that too. That is the first step. 


Thank you for reading this from the bottom of my heart and please take time to consider this not just here and now for me and for my campaign but every day and it is the small things that make the difference. Small embers of hope can grow to become big flames of change. A wise person told me that, and even though we have lost each other in the crowd, she was right.

story:
Starting from Scratch

We're back in the kitchen, making more soapy goodness just in time for the holidays! 

As many of you know, our soap shop has been put on hold as Carissa focused on the costume business earlier this year. As the peak season for costume accessories is soon coming to a close, we're turning our attention back to our passion - creating great skin care products using all-natural ingredients as an alternative to common household goods. 

The reception we had to starting our business last year was phenomenal. We raised enough funds to not only buy more equipment and test out a bunch of recipes, but also to procure many of the basics needed to launch a successful shop. We hired a graphic designer to create a stunning logo for us, acquired business cards and signage for booths and market stalls, packaging, and even custom stamps with our logo. We're off to a great start!

Soap My Back, I'll Soap Yours

We've got all of our equipment.

We have all of the marketing materials we'll need. 

We even have a recipe book where we've marked down all of the tried and true formulas we've tested out with great success. 

What we're looking for now is to add to our collection of essential oils, herbs, and fresh produce to be able to create scrumptious new soap scents in time for the holidays. 

By helping us finance this year's seasonal scents, you'll get to choose from an assortment of handmade soaps that are perfect for this time of year - whether for giving as gifts to friends and family, or as a way to pamper yourself. 

All funds raised through this campaign will be used to purchase the following: 
- Essential oils that will help us craft the perfect seasonal scents for both Fall and Winter, including some more exotic scents;
- Base oils used in the production of soaps, such as organic coconut oil, sweet almond oil, grapeseed oil, castor oil and others;
- Natural butters such as cocoa butter and shea butter for their moisturizing properties;
- Herbs, spices, produce, and other mix-in ingredients to accentuate texture or influence the scents of our products, such as pumpkin, apple, and flax. 

In exchange for contributing to our campaign, you will receive some of our delightful handmade soaps, or select from lotion bars or bath bombs. We'll also have cinnamon ornaments and balsam sachets available this year!

The Results

The more assistance we get with this fundraising campaign, the more variety we will be able to produce for this year's holiday season. While we already have a sizable assortment of essential oils, we have a few others (some of which can be pretty pricey per ounce) that we would love to add to the selection. 

Our eventual goal is to work up to a brick and mortar storefront over the next few years. So far, we've established our web presence and have sold some of our products in person. We would love to be able to have inventory to do local holiday markets and events, as well as keep up with holiday demand. This fundraiser will help us get a head start on that, since we won't have to slowly finance everything out of pocket. 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges we had with the beginnings of our soap business was getting the recipe just right. We've nailed down a few great basic soap recipes, but now we're experimenting with the ingredients to add to the base. 

We've found that some natural scents - like orange, for example - can fade over time and need to be treated differently from other scents. 

Other essential oils might cause strange reactions with the soap batter, resulting in a batch "seizing" or otherwise becoming unworkable. 

Most of these results can only be discovered by using trial and error. We've got a good bit of experience under our belts at this point, so here's hoping there's less error in the trials. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us out financially, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Our products make fantastic Christmas gifts!

You can also "Like" us on Facebook and follow our store on Etsy: 
http://www.facebook.com/ScrubOakSoaps
http://scruboaksoaps.etsy.com

story:
Mama Knows Yorkshire

I'm Kellie Whitehead, an award winning entrepreneur who believes in family, community and value. I have created a successful online and offline 'mama' brands via a magazine website, and offline events in Dubai UAE, running profitably for 5 years+

mama Knows Yorkshire has existed since September 2014 and has run 11 SOLD OUT Cinemama events for the families of South Yorkshire - but it's not enough:

It was always my aim for www.mamaknowsyorkshire.com to become

  • A regional ' Go to' magazine website for Yorkshire families
  • To showcase and promote original, regional content, articles and more
  • To showcase 'mamavents' offline brands such as #Cinemama, #mamameets and more

So why not?

I'm a busy breadwinner - I've 3 children and I'm building my business day by day, I don't want to launch *anything* I don't love - I'm stubborn like that.

I want some brilliant ' MKY' branding, so truly ' Yorkshire' I want to snog it, and a gorgeous, functional shiny new website that fits the bill for our forthcoming witty repartees, must read articles and fab photos.

This is where you guys come in!

What We Need 

  • I want to raise £3000
  • This will enable me to work with a  handpicked YORKSHIRE based Brand and development company to start the foundations of the MKY journey.
  • This is a typical costing of both a branding exercise and a specific site build
  • The site will originally be populated with content from myself, and local contributors

The Impact

I've worked hard working for families and small businesses over the past 6 years. I've worked hard for my own family, and I believe in the power of ' details' - providing quality experiences, with the extra mile, in a  value bracket that families appreciate, wherever they are in the world.

I want to see more of this in the UK, and I'm eager to start. :)

I'm not able to self fund what I need to see MKY become what it should, and fill a regional niche for quality online content, relevant to the families of this amazing county we live in.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute ? I understand completely, if only I could help all of those I would like to!, but you CAN help me in other waysbut that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

A HUGE thank you, for even stopping buy to read this, and if I've convinced you to help me build the next chapter, I thank you again, from the bottom of my heart.

Kellie

story:
Spoke Bicycle Cafe is a new destination on the LA River Bike Path in Frogtown/Elysian Valley in Los Angeles. We are in a state of transition right now, but our passions include bikes, coffee, delicious & healthy food and drinks, art, and music. We plan to bring all of this to our space on the river and we hope you will join us as our project evolves.

We are trying to create something new that will put LA on the map for being forward thinking, innovative and community-minded. We believe in our idea and we know many others we have met along this journey do too. Thank you so much for your support and for being a part of the early days of this incredible adventure. 

We are currently OPEN 8:30am to 7:00pm 

Thursday – Sunday

WHO WE ARE

We are Laurie Winston and Rich Latronica, Atwater Village residents who love to ride our bikes to places with tasty food and drinks, fun and interesting people, and beautiful sights and sounds.  This is our labor of love, our commitment to our ideals and ideas, and our attempt at creating something new and amazing in this city we all call home, the city that has everything.  Except it doesn't have this. 

A little more about us

Laurie

laurie@spokebicyclecafe.com

I enjoy traveling, learning new skills, walking and biking around Los Angeles, and making/eating delicious food.  I come from a family of restaurant owners, caterers, and bakers, and have worked in the food service or hospitality industry for most of my life.  I specialize in vegetarian food and love menu planning.  This is my first restaurant venture on my own. My educational background is in Environmental Education as well as Environmental Policy and Planning and am currently pursuing a new interest in Psychology.  Sustainability and working with our local environment are important aspects in the development of this project for me.  I like gardening, my dogs, hiking, yoga, dancing, and listening to live music. I love exploring new places and believe you can't really get to know a place until you experience it on foot, by bike, or at a slower pace than an automobile.  I love meeting new people and am excited to have the opportunity to help create this awesome space for you all.  I prefer light roast Aeropress coffee and almond cappuccinos.  I'm a newly trained bicycle mechanic and teaching other women to become more self-sufficient with their bikes is a passion of mine.  I'm currently riding a flat bar commuter hybrid, an older model Specialized Sirrus Comp.


Rich

rich@spokebicyclecafe.com

I am a coffee geek who loves new technology. My education is in Information Systems Technology.  I currently roast my own beans on a Hot Top and explore new and different roasting techniques all the time.  I plan on taking my roasting to a larger scale as Spoke progresses.  I am on a constant quest for innovation and efficiency and.  I love finding new products and methods of doing things and introducing them to people.  I'm an information junkie.  My drink of choice is the deceptively simple Americano.  I like playing, listening to, and producing music, taking photos, and brewing beer.  I plan to eventually serve my own beer at Spoke, which will be brewed onsite in an open location where people can really see how the process works. Sourcing local, well-made products and ingredients is very important to me.  I enjoy fixing things and solving complicated problems.  I spend a lot of time walking and biking in LA.  Inattentive drivers are my foes.  I'm currently rocking a Trek 7.2FX and am mainly a commuter. 

Our Mission:

We believe in quality work and quality products made by local people.  We strive to keep improving the community and involving locals in our plans.  We will build an inclusive place where people feel welcome and comfortable.  We are designing a beautiful space that enhances the natural environment.  We will support and include other local businesses as much as possible.  We enjoy producing and serving creative, tasty beverages.  We source delicious food that tastes as good as it is good for you.  We love bicycling, encouraging people to travel by bicycle, and helping people learn about and improve their bikes.  We create new concepts, innovative ideas, and adapt to the changing world.

What is Spoke Bicycle Cafe?

Located in Elysian Valley/Frogtown at the end of a dead end street in an industrial and residential area, we share a large border with the LA River bike and pedestrian path.  There are very few convenient services for the neighborhood and we would like to provide both neighborhood residents and path users with food and drinks. a gathering space, bicycle repair services and rentals, as well as music and art events. 

We want to create a place that people are proud to have in their neighborhood and a place people are excited to come visit.  We want more people to discover the river.  There aren't very many places for the people of LA to go so close to home where they can forget about the traffic, the hustle and bustle, and chaos of everyday life. The river is one of these places. We don't hear traffic here. We hear birds, see wildlife, see native river plants. We don't have to hurry here. We want to help people experience this valuable and life-enriching area.

We are following the principles behind the adaptive reuse building philosophy, where we are using what we have, but making it better. We are renovating existing buildings, not tearing them down and putting in something that clashes with the look and culture of the area. We have chosen to work with the industrial/nature dichotomy of the site and will enhance the area, not detract from it.

The bike shop is open now.  We repair bikes, sell accessories, and recently began renting bicycles as well.  We are improving the bike shop every week, so come in and see what we've added lately.  We have a shaded area with free water, restrooms, and great company for people to relax on hot days.  We currently sell a variety of healthy snacks and cold drinks, along with T shirts and an ever changing selection of our famous five dollar records.  We have live music on the weekends and have events like tie dye parties, art shows, and bicycle repair clinics.  We will continue all of this as we expand and  continue to promote non-motorized forms of transportation. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our first project is to build a full kitchen in order to offer freshly made breakfast items, sandwiches, salads, bowls and other tasty foods.  We will also be expanding our coffee offerings and introducing new, exciting beverage choices like smoothies, tonics, and juices.  We plan to serve healthy and delicious California-style food, craft beer and wine with an emphasis on local breweries and wineries. Phase two of our project will involve brewing our own beer.  Our emphasis will be on delicious food that makes people feel good and comes from as close by as we can get it.  There will be food options for all types of diets, including vegetarian, gluten free, paleo, and french fry lovers.  

We have the plans ready and all the sign offs from the city, but we need some help with the funds to actually build the kitchen.  We have come up with a lot of cool ways you can contribute and get some amazing perks!

  • This first phase we are asking for $25,000.00 
  • Check out the our unique offerings that include Coffee for a year, an invite to our big party, bike tune-ups for a lifetime, and opportunities to have your name  on our living wall or on one of the rental bikes. 
  • All funds are going directly to building of our full service kitchen.

The Impact

We want to provide needed and desired services for the people who already live in the neighborhood as well as the many city residents who use the path for exercise, recreation, and rejuvenation. We have received a lot of positive feedback from neighbors and local residents who want a place where they can have a beer or a glass of wine along with a meal in their community; a place with enough space to bring the kids, the family dog, their bicycles (without having to worry about them getting stolen). We want to provide that space. We get so many people who come in every day and say, "what a great space, so much potential." We want to realize that potential and give the people what they want! Your contribution will allow us to serve the bike and river community and offer a destination for the many LA River and Frogtown visitors. We strive to make the space better and involve the community by using the many artists and manufacturers from Frogtown to build and stock our restaurant. 

We will be creating a gathering space and meeting place in an area that has no neighborhood center or street or much of anything for people to do to get to know one another. We've already seen this in action. People who live on the same street have met for the first time at Spoke. We've seen this happen multiple times and the immediate results are heartwarming, but the long-term results will be even better. This is how you create healthy communities who really care about each other and the well being of their neighbors, streets, sidewalks, and culture. When people have a place to get to know each other, positive things happen.

We have the opportunity to create something incredible and your support can really make a difference.  Thank you so much.  We can't wait to meet you all!
