 I'm a newly trained bicycle mechanic and teaching other women to become
 more self-sufficient with their bikes is a passion of mine.  I'm 
currently riding a flat bar commuter hybrid, an older model Specialized 
Sirrus Comp.
Rich
rich@spokebicyclecafe.com
I
 am a coffee geek who loves new technology. My education is in Information Systems Technology.  I currently roast my own beans on a 
Hot Top and explore new and different roasting techniques all the time. 
 I plan on taking my roasting to a larger scale as Spoke progresses.  I 
am on a constant quest for innovation and efficiency and.  I love 
finding new products and methods of doing things and introducing them to
 people.  I'm an information junkie.  My drink of choice is the 
deceptively simple Americano.  I like playing, listening to, and 
producing music, taking photos, and brewing beer.  I plan to eventually 
serve my own beer at Spoke, which will be brewed onsite in an open 
location where people can really see how the process works. Sourcing 
local, well-made products and ingredients is very important to me.  I 
enjoy fixing things and solving complicated problems.  I spend a lot of 
time walking and biking in LA.  Inattentive drivers are my foes.  I'm 
currently rocking a Trek 7.2FX and am mainly a commuter.  Our Mission:

We believe in quality work and quality products made by local people. 
 We strive to keep improving the community and involving locals in our 
plans. 
 We will build an inclusive place where people feel welcome and 
comfortable.  We are designing a beautiful space that 
enhances the natural environment. 

We will support and include other local businesses as much as 
possible.  We enjoy producing and serving creative, 
tasty beverages.  We source 
delicious food that tastes as good as it is good for you.  We love bicycling, encouraging people to travel by bicycle, and helping people learn about and improve their bikes.  We create new concepts, innovative ideas, 
and adapt to the changing world.  
What is Spoke Bicycle Cafe? 
Located
 in Elysian Valley/Frogtown at the end of a dead end street in an 
industrial and residential area, we share a large border with the LA 
River bike and pedestrian path.  There are very few convenient services 
for the neighborhood and we would like to provide both neighborhood 
residents and path users with food and drinks. a gathering space, 
bicycle repair services and rentals, as well as music and art events.  
We want to create a place that people are proud to have in their neighborhood and a place people are excited to come visit.  We want more people to discover the river.  There aren't very many places for the
people of LA to go so close to home where they can forget about the traffic,
the hustle and bustle, and chaos of everyday life. The river is one of these
places. We don't hear traffic here. We hear birds, see wildlife, see native
river plants. We don't have to hurry here. We want to help people experience
this valuable and life-enriching area. 

We are
following the principles behind the adaptive reuse building philosophy, where
we are using what we have, but making it better. We are renovating existing
buildings, not tearing them down and putting in something that clashes with the
look and culture of the area. We have chosen to work with the industrial/nature
dichotomy of the site and will enhance the area, not detract from it. 

The bike shop is open now.  We repair bikes, sell accessories, and recently began renting bicycles as well.  We are improving the bike shop every week, so come in and see what we've added lately.  We have a shaded area with free water, restrooms, and great company for people to relax on hot days.  We currently sell a variety of healthy snacks and cold drinks, along with T shirts and an ever changing selection of our famous five dollar records.  We have live music on the weekends and have events like tie dye parties, art shows, and bicycle repair clinics.  We will continue all of this as we expand and  continue to promote non-motorized forms of transportation.  
  What We Need & What You Get Our first 
project is to build a full kitchen in order to offer freshly made breakfast items, sandwiches, salads, bowls and other tasty foods.  We will also be 
expanding our coffee offerings and introducing new, exciting beverage 
choices like smoothies, tonics, and juices.  We plan to serve healthy and delicious California-style food, craft beer
 and wine with an emphasis on local breweries and wineries. Phase two of our project will involve brewing our own beer.  Our emphasis will be on delicious food that makes people feel good and comes from as close by as we can get it.  There will be food options for all types of diets, including vegetarian, gluten free, paleo, and french fry lovers.   
We have the plans ready and all the sign offs from the city, but we need some help with the funds to actually build the kitchen.  We have come up with a lot of cool ways you can contribute and get some amazing perks! 
 This first phase we are asking for $25,000.00  Check out the our unique offerings that include Coffee for a year, an invite to our big party, bike tune-ups for a lifetime, and opportunities to have your name  on our living wall or on one of the rental bikes.  All funds are going directly to building of our full service kitchen.    The Impact 
We
want to provide needed and desired services for the people who already live in
the neighborhood as well as the many city residents who use the path for
exercise, recreation, and rejuvenation. We have received a lot of positive
feedback from neighbors and local residents who want a place where they can
have a beer or a glass of wine along with a meal in their community; a place
with enough space to bring the kids, the family dog, their bicycles (without
having to worry about them getting stolen). We want to provide that space. We
get so many people who come in every day and say, "what a great space, so
much potential." We want to realize that potential and give the people what they want!
Your contribution will allow us to serve the bike and river community and offer a destination for the many LA River and Frogtown visitors. We strive to make the space better and involve the community by using the many artists and manufacturers from Frogtown to build and stock our restaurant.  


We will be creating a gathering space
and meeting place in an area that has no neighborhood center or street or much
of anything for people to do to get to know one another. We've already seen
this in action. People who live on the same street have met for the first time
at Spoke. We've seen this happen multiple times and the immediate results are
heartwarming, but the long-term results will be even better. This is how you
create healthy communities who really care about each other and the well being
of their neighbors, streets, sidewalks, and culture. When people have a place
to get to know each other, positive things happen. 
We have the opportunity to create something incredible and your support can really make a difference.  Thank you so much.  We can't wait to meet you all!

story:
We thank you for your contributions. Given logistical issues we're going to continue the campaign at: www.gofundme.com/legalswipe

Thank you for your support

story:
MATES WHO OPEN GATES is project developed by Rod Saal the principal of Ag Assist.

Fifteen years of unrelenting adversity in the form of drought; Flood; more drought; high dollar; low production levels; low prices for products and higher prices for inputs have all impacted on the resilience of  live and work in rural and regional communities and the communities themselves. Establish a Queensland volunteer network to deliver personal pastoral support to primary producers in drought affected regions.

  • Volunteers will be vigorously screened

  • Volunteers will be provided with training:

    • Detailed induction day 

    • Mental Health First Aid

    • Specifically tailored support resources to provide to the farmer.

  • Volunteers do not perform physical tasks (other than opening a gate), but rather offer an ear, a shoulder and then a pathway and referral to professional assistance.

  • Ag Assist staff and respected community members will provide the management committee

    Rod Saal and his team have some of the  longest experience in this type of work. He is a member of the Sisters of Charity Community Care Board; member of the Partners In Recovery Strategic Leadership Panel and immediate past chair of the Board of the Toowoomba Clubhouse. In 2013 Ag Assist completed 2 projects-one for the Queensland Alliance for Mental Health and another for Rural and Remote Mental Health Limited. Over the past 37 years, Rod has simultaneously operated a farm and a farm business management consultancy which specialises in succession planning, debt mediation, community capacity building, and mental health issues.

    Rod Saal, his staff, and his network, have experience across all industries. Rod Saal has been assisting Agriculture for 37 years. Over this time he has worked on a one to one basis with thousands of farmers from all industries.

    Rod has also been part of many teams and experiences:

  • Developing the Queensland Farm Finance Strategy in 1992.

  • Managing the Queensland Centre for Climate Applications (QCCA), as Principal Extension Officer, for the Queensland Government and supervising the  QCCA building in Tor Street in Toowoomba, (he opened the building with the then Minister for Primary Industries, Henry Palaszczuk, as recognition of his  work for QCCA)

  • Awarded a Queensland Department of Primary Industries prize for developing the extension project to take climate science and its practical applications to farmers throughout Queensland

  • Advising the Howard Government on exceptional circumstances policy and helping develop new drought products for farmers

  • Attended numerous farmer meetings to explain EC process and how it could assist them

  • Wrote 13 drought applications for the State Government to take to the Federal Government

  • Worked as a Dairy Support Worker,as part of the Dairy Regional Assistance Program (DRAP), based in Toowoomba and was quickly appointed as Team Leader. This included developing extension products and workshops to explain potential ways forward post deregulation. It was a very complicated process.

  • Contracted as a Drought Coordinator for AgForce Queensland. This role covered policy implementation and development, member assistance, policy development, media work, extension, and advocacy. Throughout this role, Rod Saal:

    • Assisted in developing the National Agricultural Monitoring System (NAMS)

    • Prepared AgForce Qld’s detailed report for the Productivity Commission enquiry into drought and managed their study tour  and workshops throughout Queensland

    • Assisted the Salvation Army produce the DVD: Celebrating Life in The Bush

    • Proved an ability to take difficult concepts (i.e. EC assistance, Government policy, Community engagement, Internet and Web remote access communication processes) to remote and regional communities and present them  in a practical manner that is easy for farmers to grasp.

  • Ag Assist is based in Toowoomba but operates overseas and throughout Queensland and Australia.

  • Rod Saal was awarded an Order of Australia Medal for his services to Primary industry and regional Queensland.

  • Ag Assist currently has 2 full time and 4 part time/casual staff; with access to many more experienced and suitably qualified staff and consultants. It has the capacity to manage the projectandhasjust moved into new, more spacious offices.

  • Rod Saal OAM is a Member of AGInstituteofAustralia and is a Certified Practicing Agriculturist (CPAg) under the AGI  accreditation system. Rod Saal OAM is also a member of the Australian AssociationofAgricultural Consultantsand QueenslandJusticesassociation.

  • Rod Saal is a Justice of the Peace, qualified.

MWOG was initially funded as a pilot by Qld Health in January 2014 for 6 months. The pilot covered the Toowoomba Regional and South Burnett Regional Council areas. It was oversubscribed by volunteers; original or 20 between both regions but over 80 volunteers completed training. Farmer and grazier numbers requesting assistance also were more than double that expected.

Due to state Govt budget constraints the pilot could not be extended. It is proposed to crowd fund an extension of the project for 2 years throughout all drought affected regions of Queensland. Detailed budgets, based on experience gained in the pilot have been completed.

In mid-2014 Uniting Care Community offered to fund a logo and website for MWOG. This process has commenced but needs funding to be completed and maintained.

story: I am on a mission to spread joy and love across this planet by being the change I wish to see in the world. For over 4 years I have been traveling the U.S. sharing my healing gifts, teaching classes, volunteering my time to various love and service based organizations in order to assist people in remembering how to love themselves more. Now, I am ready to go deeper with this work by entering into Ministry training with the Center for Sacred Studies (centerforsacredstudies.org). This collective of wisdom keepers honors all cultures and paths to the Divine. Their mission is to help preserve the teachings of many indigenous cultures who view all life as sacred and intend to remain in harmony with Earth, caring for our precious resources of clean air, water, soil, etc. . I am asking for your help in assisting me to do this work in order to contribute more healing love to the planet. My intention is to be a vessel for God's love, to serve in the best way I am able. Thank you for your support. Blessings, Mandy

story:
All of our lives have recently been affected by the Baltimore riots, and while Pigtown is grateful to have escaped much of the violence impacting so many of our fellow citizens, several of our businesses received damage over the past few nights. Pigtown is our home, and the Washington Boulevard main street is the heart of our community. Places like Nick’s Rotisserie are gathering spots for all and their famous food is a point of pride for many of us. Total Health Care provides important health care for children, prescription services, and mental health treatment for local residents. Almost all of our businesses are family owned and operated, with little margin for repairs. Meanwhile, their financial situation becomes even more dire with each day they’re required to be closed.


Help us help our merchants by donating to the Pigtown Pride fund! An estimated $4,500 in repairs is needed, and your support allows us to get our local businesses the funds they need quickly and effectively. In the past 2 years we’ve seen significant improvement on our Main Street and we can’t let recent tragic events stop that momentum. Your gift is tax deductible and will support needed repairs to several of our businesses including:

  • No Limit Communications
  • Total Health Care
  • Dollar General
  • Nick’s Rotisserie

Every dollar amount counts, and we need YOUR investment. If you can’t donate, please join us on Saturday, May 2 for Bloom the Boulevard, our annual spring cleaning and greening event. Let’s come together as a community and show our pride!

story:
Heartsong’s Caribbean Crunchies Bakery and Café will be a vibrant, exciting, yet relaxing Caribbean experience with tantalizing healthy Original and Gluten-Free Crunchies, foods and juices; all 100% organic - bringing some Island culture, music and tastes to the town of Crested Butte!!

$ 15,000 is not that big a number.  50 people who contribute $ 20 in one day creates $ 1,000......... x 15 days = $ 15,000!! 

Can 10 people contribute $ 20 each and get 4 people each to contribute $20 each?  That is $ 1000 right there!!  No amount is too small - it all adds up!!  Thank you!!

 

I am Ron Edwards, Owner and Baker of Heartsong’s Caribbean Crunchies (my own recipe) I am a Service-Disabled Veteran (USMC) and also a successful business owner of Focus Advertising Specialties, having just entered our 11 year!  It has always been my desire to provide an inviting environment where I can introduce people to deliciously healthy foods.

Being diagnosed and living with Multiple Sclerosis, and having recovered from a Traumatic Brain Injury, taught me how incredibly important food is in the healing process and for sustaining health.  I got really serious about eating organic foods and it has made a life affirming difference in my recovery.  That is why I am so passionate about introducing this to my community and beyond, as a way of life, health and joy.

We need to raise $15,000 to upgrade to a commercial kitchen in our newly rented retail space in the heart of Crested Butte, CO so we can open Heartsong's Caribbean Bakery and Café.  For the past 11 months we have been renting commercial kitchens and have had limited time and/or space to bake in.  Having our own commercial kitchen and retail bakery/cafe in 1 location, so we can bake and sell my Organic Crunchies and healthy food, is incredibly important to us moving forward. This opportunity, combined with overwhelming community support and excitement is astounding!!

My initial foray into this market began at the Crested Butte Farmers Market in Colorado last year.  From the beginning I sold out within 2 hours every Sunday and had to triple the amount I produced to meet the weekly demand over the 19 weeks of the Farmers Market (June through October). 

Retail locations up and down the Gunnison Valley carry my Crunchies and most notably, the Crested Butte Community School (K through 12) Cafeteria routinely purchases about $400.00 worth every month!!   The children (and parents) love the 2 oz. Crunchie Energy Bars!!  

With Flexible Funding - we get to keep whatever is raised!! This will help us immensely to purchase the equipment we need to upgrade our space to a commercial kitchen, such as; a Bakers Pride commercial Convection oven, 2 door display refrigerator, a display counter, a commercial freezer, Hobart mixer, hand sink and prep sink (and plumbing installation) stainless steel work tables & shelves, and create a “Colorful Caribbean Environment”.

                                      

The growth potential that we will be able to expand to in our second year is phenomenal!!  My initial recipe is what we call our Original Crunchie and, by request, we added a tasty Gluten-Free version too.  My Crunchie recipe is also formed into 2oz Original and Gluten-Free Energy Bars, which are great for active people like mountain bikers, hikers, skiers, travelers etc. 

Below are photos of some exciting perks for your contributions, such as; ¼ lb., ½ lb., 1lb and 2lbs of Crunchies, thermal totes (lunch/snack tote and grocery tote sizes), stainless steel water bottles, acrylic tumblers, t-shirts, pens, and bumper stickers.

             

 


If you aren’t able to contribute but would love to help ~ please email our Indiegogo campaign link http://igg.me/p/heartsong-s-caribbean-crunchies-bakery-cafe/x/10622680 or use the Indiegogo share tools to reach out to your friends and family and ask them for their support! We want as many people to know about our amazing Crunchies!!

Thank you all for your generous contributions and for helping us reach our goal and make our vision come true!

want as many people to know about our amazing Crunchies!!

us reach our goal and make our vision come true!

story:
Short Summary

Four Directions Cooperative Centre for Trauma Recovery Inc. is a revolutionary cooperative development aimed at reducing suffering and maintaining wellness among trauma affected young people. 

By cooperatively and holistically walking alongside trauma survived youth, we strive to offer comprehensive opportunity of personal mastery that may lead to the discovery of human potential and actualization. With commitment to lifelong wellness, we collaborate with community based supports, honoring the strength, suffering, and resilience of each individual culturally, spiritually, emotionally, mentally, and physically; providing mentor-supported collective care beyond the safety of the six month trauma recovery stay.

We offer eclectic opportunity for healing and growth within the four directions of the participant, enabling them to identify and build upon areas of strength. Through the use of equine therapy, greenhouse programming, culture, physical training, and experiential learning, participants will have unlimited access to realistic longitudinal recovery from maladaptive coping. 

What We Need & What You Get

Through community partnerships and government organizations our dream of opening a facility to transfer youth out of hotel rooms and into caring environments with experienced staff is coming to fruition. However, we need capital to be able to open the facility, which government organizations are not able to provide. 

We are looking for donations, or individuals to buy into the cooperative, to make this a reality. As a co-operative member, you would have the opportunity to participate as a board member, planning committees, interested community member, and voting rights on upcoming decisions. 

The Impact

The need for trauma recovery care for our youth in CFS care is growing. It is observed within the systems to which this population belongs that there are increasing rates of involvement related to maladaptive coping from traumatic experience. Involvement and re-involvement in the criminal justice system, hospitalization due to long wait times into addiction treatment and stabilization services. The growing rates of involvement into gang culture and lateral violence  reflects the increasing need for intensive, safe, flexible and sustainable helping resources for this particular vulnerable population. 

FDCCTR offers a safe and comfortable environment to begin trauma based healing, using sustainable means within one's body, mind, emotions, and spirit. With a team of supports surrounding the individual within and beyond the centre, participants may have opportunity to best utilize an extension of care by adopting sustainable healing and coping techniques, discover untapped skills and develop unique human capacity. 

We have the ability to change the course of an individuals life, to better our communities, and provide opportunities not otherwise provided. What better way to make a difference in our community than to start with our young people, helping them find their way, and make a real difference in the lives of those around us. 

Risks & Challenges

Our major challenges at this point hinge on long term funding. Often, organizations who are willing to fund projects such as this require proof of the program's success. To be able to provide the proof that we know is  possible we need to cover start up costs. 

The facility, land, staffing, and all mandatory arrangements are in order and ready to be rolled out as soon as we have the funds we need. Similar facilities exist in other areas of Canada, and it is time to bring the model to Manitoba. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this on to others who you believe may be interested in joining our co-operative. Share it on facebook, spread the word. It is through individuals that we can make a collective difference.
story_txt:
Short Summary Four Directions Cooperative Centre for Trauma Recovery Inc. is a revolutionary cooperative development aimed at reducing suffering and maintaining wellness among trauma affected young people. 
By cooperatively and holistically walking alongside trauma survived youth, we strive to offer comprehensive opportunity of personal mastery that may lead to the discovery of human potential and actualization. With commitment to lifelong wellness, we collaborate with community based supports, honoring the strength, suffering, and resilience of each individual culturally, spiritually, emotionally, mentally, and physically; providing mentor-supported collective care beyond the safety of the six month trauma recovery stay.
We offer eclectic opportunity for healing and growth within the four directions of the participant, enabling them to identify and build upon areas of strength. Through the use of equine therapy, greenhouse programming, culture, physical training, and experiential learning, participants will have unlimited access to realistic longitudinal recovery from maladaptive coping.    What We Need & What You Get Through community partnerships and government organizations our dream of opening a facility to transfer youth out of hotel rooms and into caring environments with experienced staff is coming to fruition. However, we need capital to be able to open the facility, which government organizations are not able to provide. 
We are looking for donations, or individuals to buy into the cooperative, to make this a reality. As a co-operative member, you would have the opportunity to participate as a board member, planning committees, interested community member, and voting rights on upcoming decisions. 
    The Impact The need for trauma recovery care for our youth in CFS care is growing. It is observed within the systems to which this population belongs that there are increasing rates of involvement related to maladaptive coping from traumatic experience. Involvement and re-involvement in the criminal justice system, hospitalization due to long wait times into addiction treatment and stabilization services. The growing rates of involvement into gang culture and lateral violence  reflects the increasing need for intensive, safe, flexible and sustainable helping resources for this particular vulnerable population. 
FDCCTR offers a safe and comfortable environment to begin trauma based healing, using sustainable means within one's body, mind, emotions, and spirit. With a team of supports surrounding the individual within and beyond the centre, participants may have opportunity to best utilize an extension of care by adopting sustainable healing and coping techniques, discover untapped skills and develop unique human capacity. 
We have the ability to change the course of an individuals life, to better our communities, and provide opportunities not otherwise provided. What better way to make a difference in our community than to start with our young people, helping them find their way, and make a real difference in the lives of those around us. 
    Risks & Challenges Our major challenges at this point hinge on long term funding. Often, organizations who are willing to fund projects such as this require proof of the program's success. To be able to provide the proof that we know is  possible we need to cover start up costs. 
The facility, land, staffing, and all mandatory arrangements are in order and ready to be rolled out as soon as we have the funds we need. Similar facilities exist in other areas of Canada, and it is time to bring the model to Manitoba. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Please pass this on to others who you believe may be interested in joining our co-operative. Share it on facebook, spread the word. It is through individuals that we can make a collective difference.

story:
Contributors:
Hector D Perez       ( Inventor, R&D scientific development)
Wilson Ortiz             ( Mechanical Engineer , operations)


Intent : To create public access library and museum to safeguard  the conservation of technology  and devices to be used for future generations  as , super efficient motors and other  solar powered devices  of low cost and construction efforts, to provide information (open source) to general public to produce & benefit from such devices , electrical, medical,tooling, scientific , farming, energy independence & others .

Contributors  as well as the general public will be able to access reliable lab tested  and proven technology  with free internet served resources for all of the above devices  plus be able to see real working models of such  items  certified by engineers to be true working samples, as aquaponics  and hydroponics solar assisted indoor farming for producing non-radioactive food sources within enclosed pest free environments , this done maximizing performance & lowering  cost with 5th generation inexpensive chromatic spectrum specific led illumination .   

To provide these FREE services ..

 The sum of $10,000,000 USD is initially required :

 Itemized this will go as :

 $1,000,000. Building acquisition

 $1,000,000. Full green  energy conversion (off grid) and retrofitted.    

 $1,500,000. Terra-servers , (computers) , copiers, printers & general library  items.

    $500,000. For  general lab equipment and machines & tools required                                                 for   operation & maintenance and in house research & building

   $6,000.000  to operate during 5 years non stop

This will include visitors and volunteer quarters  , training services and community & international services  , some specialist & special services non-volunteer wages and related costs .

The information disseminated will empower people to  self develop worldwide  cooperatives  using reliable, devices & application in alternate energy at 5th generation level not available at this date to the general  public.    

 Challenges

  Transparency is priority , so the incorporates will use an open book policy on every cent spent , every item will be  identified and traceable , every expenditure will be booked   and recorded ,as well as services provided , wages, purchases , this being available  in the Internet servers in a non-alterable non erasable write only database for public review and comment. the operation will be non-profit oriented  and  full non-profit status  acquired as final project step  .


    Ways You Can Help!

    Become aware that useful self reliability  information is being restricted , that reliable projects are hard to find, as there are hardships as where to get  the hardware and the information. It is often troublesome not acquiring the intended results being searched , resulting in money waste , resources wasted and time wasted , leaving people hanging in the string of unaccountability by those providing the information, often at a great cost to the  purchasers of that information, information we intent to give free , no scams, no deceit , no greed , in a new vision the world requires , a depository of open souce information & technology

story:
In today's fast-paced world, we are all surrounded by negativity and stress. We spend our days rushing from appointment to appointment, never stopping completely long enough to fully enjoy the world that is outside our bubble. It seems that most of our issues stem from negativity thoughts, feelings and experiences, and they are the roots of all our troubles. While negative thoughts tend to lead to negative actions, positivity begets positivity, and there simply cannot be enough positive thought or action in the world. Along this philosophy, we created 'Occasional Muse' as an Instagram account with the aim of spreading positivity via a series of daily inspirational quotes.



'Occasional Muse' hopes to continue to be the bearer of love and positive thinking through our Instagram quotes. Our followers have been growing steadily and we hope to widen our reach towards more individuals suffering from negativity overload. After seeing the incredibly positive response and following we have earned from starting Occasional Muse, we decided that we needed to take it one step further in order to expand our reach.


Our goal is to expand our inspirational Instagram feed into a social enterprise / socially minded business, in which we will be self-sufficient as a business as well as working towards generating funds for our humanitarian projects.


We will be designing and producing Occasional Muse merchandise with inspirational and motivational quotes such as:
  • T-Shirts
  • Canvas Tote Bags
  • Notebooks
  • Stationeries
  • Postcard Sets
  • Mugs
  • Coaster Set
  • Canvas Prints

*Our prime motivation is to spread positivity and make the world a better place to live in. 10-15% of sales proceeds will head into our Humanitarian Projects Fund (which will be set-up alongside with our business - Idea of Social Selling). Thus this project is crucial in realizing our dream.



To achieve our goals, we are seeking funding of at least $35,000.
Your generous donations will go to the following:




In-depth details of the 40% Operations Cost:

- Space Rental – 20%, 
- Equipment Purchase – 5%
- Manpower – 15%

*Any extra funds raised will be evenly distributed to the various costs, with the main bulk into the Humanitarian project fund (Which is going to be set-up along with our business).

By donating to our cause, you are helping us sustain what we have been doing so far (providing our Instagram readers with daily positive posts), aid us in making our mechandise available worldwide and be confident that your hard-earned dollars are going to help children learn to read, write, and become positive members of their community.




A5 Leather Notebooks

We have just included the PLAIN versions! So our backers will have both PLAIN / RULED notebooks to choose from!

Heavy Cotton Canvas Tote Bag

Leather Pocket T-Shirts (Unisex & Ladies)



Carpenter Pencils (Set of 5)


Assorted Stickers (Set of 6)

Rubber Coasters (Set of 5)


Canvas Prints (30 x 30 cm)


For higher tiered perks, we'll be sending perks on your behalf to underpriviledged children! Please view the perks details on the right column.

*Final designs and colors of perks may vary slightly. At the end of the campaign we will email you to get your design, color and size preferences.





    BESIDES OUR AIM TO SPREAD POSITIVE VIBES & THINKING TO THE PEOPLE AROUND US, our prime motivation is to build a better society to live in. We want to serve the community at large as well as the social media community. As we strongly believe in the power of positive thinking and charitable works, we pledge an estimated 10-15% of ALL OUR SALES PROCEEDS (Not just from the funding we received here) into our humanitarian project fund.

    Through this fund that we'll set up alongside our business, our team will contribute:

    - Merchandise
    - Educational supplies
    - Financial donations to go towards the building of classrooms and schools for under-privileged children in less developed countries.

    We plan to work directly with our friends in volunteering in Cambodia, Thailand, Myanmar and Nepal. Though, we are confident that we will be able to expand our humanitarian project fund into other countries as our sales expand.

    *Our first project is expected to start 6 months after the launch of our business (Jan/Feb 2016).

    We believe that, in order for the world to experience more love and acceptance towards one another, all children across the world should have access to a proper education regardless of their situation.



    Start of Campaign: End April 2015
    End of Campaign: Start June 2015

    Design and Production of Merchandise: By End June 2015
    Shipping of Perks: Between July - Aug 2015
    Occasional Muse Webstore launch: Mid July 2015
    Merchandise to be made available to other eCommerce platforms: August 2015
    First Humanitarian project (~6 months after targeted webstore launch): Jan – Feb 2016

    *All our pledgers and supporters under our mailing list will be updated regularly with our progress. It is extremely important to us that you will be part of the process!


    Crowdfunding is an amazing way to include all our supporters and like-minded individuals to our cause. Not only do we want our community to feel being part of this process, we invite you to give us feedback and ideas and help us perfect our concept. A business requires a significant amount of start-up capital, so we definitely need all the financial help we can get as well. Also, the more people get behind the project, the easier it’ll be for us to put together a self-sufficient business and start our humanitarian projects sooner. We want to do this together with all of YOU, our amazing and loving supporters who identify with us and share our vision!

    However, if you can't donate at this time, there are still many ways to help us fund our project! Please share our story and Instagram account information via social media, email and word of mouth to tell your friends about our campaign!


    OUR CAMPAIGN (Please share our link!) - http://igg.me/at/occasionalmuse

    INSTAGRAM - http://www.instagram.com/occasionalmuse
    FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/occasionalmuse
    TUMBLR - http://occasional-muse.tumblr.com
    TWITTER - http://www.twitter.com/_occasionalmuse

    Thank you in advance!

    “It takes a lot of people to make a winning team. Everybody's contribution is important.”  -  Gary David Goldberg 


    *Every perk will come with free quote cards - which you'll be able to write a message and pass on the positivity to someone else. Sometimes, all it takes is a small gesture to make another's day :)


    WHEN WILL THE PERKS BE DELIVERED?

    We'll start delivering the perks and provide more information and details on the delivery after the campaign. As soon as the merchandise are made available to us, we'll be sending them out. We estimate that the perks should reach you between 2-3 months after our campaign ends:

    End May - June 2015 – Design and production of merchandise
    Between July - Aug 2015– Worldwide shipping via Sea Freight


    HOW WILL THE FUNDERS BE KEPT INFORMED DURING AND AFTER THE CAMPAIGN?

    We'll be sending all of our supporters updates through our Indiegogo page and via email to the email address you have provided when signing up to the Indiegogo site. We'll also post updates on our Campaign link, Facebook, Website and Twitter pages.

    I HAVE POSTED A QUESTION TO THE SITE. WHEN WILL I GET A RESPONSE? 

    We’ve have a lot of questions coming in daily and we are doing our very best to answer them all as soon as possible, so we hope for your patience and understanding.

    We’ll try our best to answer all enquiries within 24 hours.

    I HAVE PURCHASED A T-SHIRT REWARD. HOW CAN I TELL YOU WHICH SIZE I WOULD LIKE TO HAVE?

    We'll contact everyone after the campaign and ask which size(s) and colour(s) you would like to receive. Our size chart will also be emailed to everyone.


    I'D LIKE TO SEND THE PERKS TO MY FAMILY & FRIENDS! CAN THE PERKS BE SHIPPED TO AN ADDRESS THAT ISN'T OUR BILLING ADDRESS?

    No problem! We'll send your perks wherever you'll want them to be shipped when they're ready to go. It doesn’t have to be the same address.


    IF THE PROJECT DOESN'T REACH IT'S FUNDING GOAL, DO I GET MY MONEY BACK?

    No, because we are doing a so-called Flexible Campaign, which means that even if we don’t reach our goal, we'll still receive all the funds raised. All the money is going towards making Occasional Muse a reality and production of the perks. Every dollar helps the cause we are doing this for.


    “Every person has a longing to be significant; to make a contribution; to be a part of something noble and purposeful.”  -  John C. Maxwell

story:
The Center for Responsible Brainwave Technologies

Consumer-oriented brain-computer interface technology (cBCI) holds great personal, commercial, and medical potential. We've already seen inspiring applications of the technology.
However, the present and near-future proliferation of cBCI in the absence of 1) common safety and privacy standards, 2) consumer understanding of the capabilities of the technology, and 3) public awareness of its potential downstream consequences constitutes a set of concerns that must be proactively addressed.

CeReB is being formed as a excellence and thought leadership for the exploration and development of ethical standards and best practices in cBCI. CeReB will foster and support research and dialogue on these issues with the goal of developing clear, meaningful, and achievable standards for ensuring the efficacy of brainwave technology and the agency, privacy, and safety of its users. CeReB will also act as a source for reliable information concerning cBCI and encourage the development of cBCI in a manner that defends consumer rights.

Board members include Brian Behlendorf from Electronic Frontier Foundation, Anne Cavoukian former Privacy Commissioner of Ontario and pioneer of Privacy by Design, Ariel Garten CEO of InteraXon, Luca Pisterzi privacy and data analytics at Ontario Brain Institute, Dirk Rodenburg Semaphore Institute, and Nita Farahany who was appointed to Obama's commission for bioethics. 

CeReB is a not for profit, and in order to exist and remain an open and transparent body for all, requires your help.
CeReB operates on a very tight budget to maintain open website and list serve, hold conferences, highlight issues to the press, and maintain a space where public, labs and industry alike can converse on the topic and tackle concerns head-on.
Please donate to bring this industry and ecosystem to safe and responsible fruition.

story:
The Inspiration

“Running on Hope” is my response to people asking, “how can God exist if there are so many starving kids in the third-world?” I read in the Bible that people are not born in the conditions they have due to something they have done but so the works of God could be displayed (John 9). There are so many different reasons for why someone or even full nations are suffering, but it is our duty to try and make a difference. With this project, we may not have the power to change the world but we have a great opportunity to make an everlasting impact on the lives of starving men, women, and children in Burkina Faso.

Short Summary

Last June, Teebo launched a pilot agricultural program to end Burkina Faso's annual Starving Season in one village, Goumsin. Farmers who were part of the program harvested more than seven times the normal amount of crops. And they doubled their yields which is equal to 8-10 months of food for a family of five. This effort truly has ended the starving season for the hard working farmers in our program for the first year. The organization wants to continue to empower a second group of farmers in Goumsin and for the first time in the village of Goennega with fertilizer, simple plows, and to help them farm more land with oxen. This program is built with sustainability in mind. Farmers who participate once will pay part of their profits to participate again. In this way, Teebo can fund program growth and reach more villages. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $10,000 in two consecutive fundraisers of $5,000 to provide 55 plows and 60 bags of fertilizers to the farmers. For every dollar raised, Joey and the other members will run one meter ($1 = 1meter).

 100% of all donations will go to the program and is tax-deductible.

Campaign rewards are beautiful traditional hands made gifts by the people of Burkina Faso, a jersey with Teebo's logo and a running on hope t-shirt.

The Impact

Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa with more than 18 million people. 80% of the population lives by subsistence farming with 90% involved in farming. Farmers work very hard to plant peanuts, beans, corn, and millet, but drought and poor soil make good harvests almost impossible. After a successful pilot program last year with the people of Goumsin, Teebo has seen the impacts. With their animal-drawn plows, farmers can now work 2.5 acres of land in two days vs. four weeks. Furrows dug by animal plows are also deeper, providing greater stability for the plants.

Your support to #EndStarvingSeason in Goumsin and Goennega will bless the community as whole and the country of Burkina Faso at long run. Why? By equipping farmers and empowering them, we lead them to fight against starving season and gain more food during harvest. In addition, part of the harvest profit can be sold to cover their kids’ school tuition, provide emergency needs to the family and cover basic needs.

Follow the Journey

Stay up to date with Teebo at www.teebo.org. Like Fishing Through Fitness for more fundraisers at www.facebook.com/fishingthroughfitness. Follow @joeymonsta for updates, workout tips, and fitness inspiration.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are exciting about the cause and would like to join us on September 05th, register HERE
  • Share this video and story with your Friends, and Tweet about us using #EndStarvingSeason, #RunningOnHope

Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the words out as well!
story_txt:
The Inspiration
“Running on Hope” is my response to people asking, “how can God exist if
there are so many starving kids in the third-world?” I read in the Bible that
people are not born in the conditions they have due to something they have done
but so the works of God could be displayed (John 9). There are so many
different reasons for why someone or even full nations are suffering, but it is
our duty to try and make a difference. With this project, we may not have the
power to change the world but we have a great opportunity to make an
everlasting impact on the lives of starving men, women, and children in Burkina
Faso. 
Short
Summary
Last June, Teebo launched
a pilot agricultural program to end Burkina Faso's annual Starving Season in
one village, Goumsin. Farmers who were part of the program harvested more
than seven times the normal amount of crops. And they doubled their yields
which is equal to 8-10 months of food for a family of five. This effort truly
has ended the starving season for the hard working farmers in our program for
the first year. The organization wants to continue to empower a second group of
farmers in Goumsin and for the first time in the village of Goennega with
fertilizer, simple plows, and to help them farm more land with oxen. This
program is built with sustainability in mind. Farmers who participate once will
pay part of their profits to participate again. In this way, Teebo can fund
program growth and reach more villages. 

What
We Need & What You Get
We are looking to
raise $10,000 in two consecutive fundraisers of $5,000 to provide 55 plows and
60 bags of fertilizers to the farmers. For every dollar raised, Joey and the
other members will run one meter ($1 = 1meter).
 100% of all
donations will go to the program and is tax-deductible.
Campaign rewards are
beautiful traditional hands made gifts by the people of Burkina Faso, a jersey
with Teebo's logo and a running on hope t-shirt.

The
Impact
Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa with
more than 18 million people. 80% of the population lives by subsistence farming
with 90% involved in farming. Farmers work very hard to plant peanuts, beans,
corn, and millet, but drought and poor soil make good harvests almost
impossible. After a successful pilot program last year with the people of
Goumsin, Teebo has seen the impacts. With their animal-drawn plows,
farmers can now work 2.5 acres of land in two days vs. four weeks. Furrows
dug by animal plows are also deeper, providing greater stability for the
plants.
Your
support to #EndStarvingSeason in Goumsin and Goennega will bless the community
as whole and the country of Burkina Faso at long run. Why? By equipping farmers
and empowering them, we lead them to fight against starving season and gain
more food during harvest. In addition, part of the harvest profit can be sold
to cover their kids’ school tuition, provide emergency needs to the family and
cover basic needs.
Follow
the Journey
Stay up to date with Teebo at www.teebo.org.
Like Fishing Through Fitness for more fundraisers at www.facebook.com/fishingthroughfitness.
Follow @joeymonsta for updates, workout tips, and fitness inspiration. 
Other
Ways You Can Help

If you are
     exciting about the cause and would like to join us on September 05th,
     register HERE



Share this
     video and story with your Friends, and Tweet about us using #EndStarvingSeason,
     #RunningOnHope

Use the Indiegogo
share tools to get the words out as well!

story: Ever since I was small, baking has been a dream for me. When I was in high school, I saw that my family wasn't going to have enough money for me to try and start working on my passion right away, so I enlisted. The Army has made a large impact on my life ( like helpful life skills and meeting my wonderful husband) and like every job, it had its ups and downs.... But my army career ended early when I was diagnosed with several debilitating issues in my lower back and hip. I had to leave the service this year. I don't see this as a reason to be sad, I see it as the point in my life to start pursuing my dream! So I created the Sweetsmith Foundry; a unique gourmet bakery. A foundry is a place where a blacksmith would create one-of-a-kind, handmade creations. That's exactly what I want to provide! With your contribution, I can get the ball rolling, start up my website, buy better mixers and the best ingredients, and be able to create amazing and tasty treats (cookies, cupcakes, cakes, and cakepops-- all custom made-to-order!) to share with the state of Colorado and later, to the entire country. I will offer gluten-free and lactose-free options especially since I, myself am lactose intolerant! Help me make my dream a reality!
